commit_message:
Reproduce bug 1945310

To properly reproduce the bug we need to modify nova's neutron fixture
to act like a real neutron when a port is queried with a non-admin
client.

A wide set of tests are added to exercise all the resource request
dependent nova code paths with a non-admin user.

Change-Id: I7db075145435ed4e832aca197a48c56264ac56ce
Related-Bug: #1945310

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-24 11:14:53.000000000', 'message': "tests: Silence noise from database tests

Various database tests were deriving from 'testtools.TestCase', which
doesn't include any fixtures for things like capturing logging. Resolve
this and explicitly configure some fixtures, removing a lot of the noise
we introduced in change Ie9d00e25b7e99104155466060a2b6f8a884a5e0a when
we removed configuration of the 'StandardLogging' fixture because the
text suggested it was no longer necessary (we weren't using the oslo_db
base test case, so it couldn't be invalidating our configuration).

Change-Id: I981f44880910cf50423a88ad3a6493f4fde2f241
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
tests: Silence noise from database tests

Various database tests were deriving from 'testtools.TestCase', which
doesn't include any fixtures for things like capturing logging. Resolve
this and explicitly configure some fixtures, removing a lot of the noise
we introduced in change Ie9d00e25b7e99104155466060a2b6f8a884a5e0a when
we removed configuration of the 'StandardLogging' fixture because the
text suggested it was no longer necessary (we weren't using the oslo_db
base test case, so it couldn't be invalidating our configuration).

Change-Id: I981f44880910cf50423a88ad3a6493f4fde2f241
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-21 16:47:42.000000000', 'message': "tests: Walk database migrations in correct order

For some reason, 'alembic.script.ScriptDirectory.walk_revisions' gives
us the revisions in reverse chronological order, meaning we need to
invert this in tests.

In addition, there were some typos and we didn't include boilerplate to
allow users to write pre- and post-upgrade checks as part of the test.
There was also an unnecessary '__init__' file along with some unused
test helpers left over. Address all issues.

Change-Id: I52a139bdf43b11268999ca0ebb940e09b567b739
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2021-09-24 11:14:53.000000000', 'message': "tests: Walk database migrations in correct order

For some reason, 'alembic.script.ScriptDirectory.walk_revisions' gives
us the revisions in reverse chronological order, meaning we need to
invert this in tests.

In addition, there were some typos and we didn't include boilerplate to
allow users to write pre- and post-upgrade checks as part of the test.
There was also an unnecessary '__init__' file along with some unused
test helpers left over. Address all issues.

Change-Id: I52a139bdf43b11268999ca0ebb940e09b567b739
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
tests: Walk database migrations in correct order

For some reason, 'alembic.script.ScriptDirectory.walk_revisions' gives
us the revisions in reverse chronological order, meaning we need to
invert this in tests.

In addition, there were some typos and we didn't include boilerplate to
allow users to write pre- and post-upgrade checks as part of the test.
There was also an unnecessary '__init__' file along with some unused
test helpers left over. Address all issues.

Change-Id: I52a139bdf43b11268999ca0ebb940e09b567b739
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix typos in ec2 credential policies

There was a trailing s in two of these policies and it caused the policy
names to mismatch, which causes confusion with the rendered policy files
and potentially causes uses with deprecation logic.

Conflicts:
      keystone/common/policies/ec2_credential.py in later releases the
      deprecated parameters were moved from the DocumentedRuleDefault
      object to the deprecated object.

Change-Id: I54021986d17c57d7733d53caa4032c2767eaf25e
(cherry picked from commit 82da8824df0f56ef4e137805bf32d647cef1ea59)
(cherry picked from commit 6dff22b5baa1a19842aca435782fe1f9789f72cc)

commit_message:
Fix typo in identity provider policies

This cause the sample generated policy file to alias the old name with
the new policy name, which isn't needed since we're not renaming these
policies at all and it was likely a typo.

Conflicts:
      keystone/common/policies/identity_provider.py
      In later releases the deprecation parameters were moved up to the
      deprecated options and not in the DocumentedRule defaults.

Change-Id: Idfd9adbbe800bbc21814d94002a2b61524cce28a
(cherry picked from commit c10d5c88ef40e63d4dfefb792d6c3d68acd72dd9)
(cherry picked from commit bdd8f82f60d2e46e5f6951c4407366b89591cde5)

commit_message:
haproxy: Add missing default_backend option

This change ensures the default_backend option is included in all
frontends, to solve the issue caused by unavailable backend service.

Closes-Bug: #1946045
Change-Id: I4856d33e6eaf5ca0fbfd9c4f33bd0d9433d107fa
(cherry picked from commit 12f14d95bb1ea4bd78e96f1f350b4bf9e2d38c3a)

I'm looking at this and have found that we're hitting this issue again:

https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/issues/36

due to this commit which was released in fasteners==0.15:

https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/commit/467ed75ee1e9465ebff8b5edf452770befb93913

Inside of the nova test fixture, we are somehow getting the unpatched version of threading.current_thread instead of the eventlet version that we need. This implies that at the time of the creation of our ReaderWriterLock inside the fixture, the threading module is not eventlet monkey patched:

https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/issues/36#issuecomment-760402680

I don't know how or why this is the case, same as bnemec mentioned here:

https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/issues/36#issuecomment-771772897

I'm going to keep looking but will need help from other nova devs who know more about eventlet."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2021-10-06 23:38:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

ok, I'll hold it back for now, but will ping every now and then in irc"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2021-10-06 23:39:49.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from openstack/requirements/constraints to openstack/requirements/constraints/noclob'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2021-10-06 23:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-10-07 01:21:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > expected, but only nova is good
> 
> I'm looking at this and have found that we're hitting this issue again:
> 
> https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/issues/36
> 
> due to this commit which was released in fasteners==0.15:
> 
> https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/commit/467ed75ee1e9465ebff8b5edf452770befb93913
> 
> Inside of the nova test fixture, we are somehow getting the unpatched version of threading.current_thread instead of the eventlet version that we need. This implies that at the time of the creation of our ReaderWriterLock inside the fixture, the threading module is not eventlet monkey patched:
> 
> https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/issues/36#issuecomment-760402680
> 
> I don't know how or why this is the case, same as bnemec mentioned here:
> 
> https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/issues/36#issuecomment-771772897
> 
> I'm going to keep looking but will need help from other nova devs who know more about eventlet.

Correction: the threading module *is* eventlet monkey patched at that point but we are going into the fallback to the native threading.current_thread because we are apparently not in a greenthread at that point:

https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/690464aee772b62a54eedf5275843dce30318597/eventlet/green/threading.py#L94-L96"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2021-10-07 01:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-10-07 02:05:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 2:
> > > 
> > > expected, but only nova is good
> > 
> > I'm looking at this and have found that we're hitting this issue again:
> > 
> > https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/issues/36
> > 
> > due to this commit which was released in fasteners==0.15:
> > 
> > https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/commit/467ed75ee1e9465ebff8b5edf452770befb93913
> > 
> > Inside of the nova test fixture, we are somehow getting the unpatched version of threading.current_thread instead of the eventlet version that we need. This implies that at the time of the creation of our ReaderWriterLock inside the fixture, the threading module is not eventlet monkey patched:
> > 
> > https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/issues/36#issuecomment-760402680
> > 
> > I don't know how or why this is the case, same as bnemec mentioned here:
> > 
> > https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/issues/36#issuecomment-771772897
> > 
> > I'm going to keep looking but will need help from other nova devs who know more about eventlet.
> 
> Correction: the threading module *is* eventlet monkey patched at that point but we are going into the fallback to the native threading.current_thread because we are apparently not in a greenthread at that point:
> 
> https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/690464aee772b62a54eedf5275843dce30318597/eventlet/green/threading.py#L94-L96

That ^ was also wrong. I put in some print statements and see that it's weirder than I expected. We're hitting a condition where the current thread is not of type GreenThread ... it's just 'greenlet.greenlet':

https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/blob/v0.32.0/eventlet/green/threading.py#L124-L128

so it's falling back to the native threading.current_thread() method bc of that."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-10-07 23:56:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

This might be totally wrong but I've proposed the following in nova to work with fasteners >= 0.15:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/813114"}]

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I6a9803c41f272bddfe5f082d564a90b4e5d0f0e8

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I14a30d7dc0023fcf952b855a6a1ed818be599473

commit_message:
Change to single NIC install page

Make it so hardware requirements are lessened by no
longer requiring two network adapters on each cloud
node. OVN Chassis will use an existing OVS bridge.
This was tested successfully.

Change-Id: I66d150df2a0e7a92c46b31398ad707c53b87bb9b

commit_message:
Revert "Pin puppet-redis to 8.0.0"

This reverts commit 4931d2cce84c61c764214360e4cf9f9a4083cdd2.

Reason for revert:
This issue was caused by a duplicate declaration detected when redis
and redis::sentinel are both included and old puppetlabs-stdlib is
used, but now redis::sentinel is no longer used.

Related-Bug: #1941772

commit_message:
Update gerrit image dep for jeepyb triggered builds

The gerrit image uses the bullseye python 3.9 image now instead of
buster 3.7. Update the depenency in project-config where we trigger
things.

commit_message:
Remove zaqar

Zaqar was deprecated in Wallaby and is no longer in use on the
undercloud and it hasn't been officially supported in the
overcloud for some time.

Related-Bug: #1945223
Change-Id: I3bdcc72d6127ec96ff2307cafbf57f6178c3ef5c
(cherry picked from commit 0c167aedea73ee0a8c7702707f59879efd48b6cd)

commit_message:
Disable file injection tests until bug/1882421

File injection tests are failing consistently on
python3 and make tempest-all job fail.
- https://zuul.openstack.org/build/9625ced67fad4fa48ad43185a3ee256f

once nova bug is fixed, we can unskip it.
- https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1882421

Related-Bug: #1882421
Change-Id: I3b683209519e6faea6305eb8d90546f46344981f

subject: Make the "success" message more "success"-like
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-07 20:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-07 20:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nnevermind, too minor to backport'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-07 20:31:38.000000000', 'message': 'Make the "success" message more "success"-like

With the current way, the ending message is a bit too similar when we
get a success or a failure:
"with error" compared to "without error" is too close, and it's easy to
overlook an potential issue.

This change changes "without error" to "successfully", making a clear
difference.

This issue was reported as-is on Red Hat Bugzilla:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1937226

Change-Id: I059de98ef3fbb8f39a4119dbf334be4b14d989ad
(cherry picked from commit 6780cd74a0a6c894215f68870a033fc7349167e6)
'}]
commit_message:
Make the "success" message more "success"-like

With the current way, the ending message is a bit too similar when we
get a success or a failure:
"with error" compared to "without error" is too close, and it's easy to
overlook an potential issue.

This change changes "without error" to "successfully", making a clear
difference.

This issue was reported as-is on Red Hat Bugzilla:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1937226

Change-Id: I059de98ef3fbb8f39a4119dbf334be4b14d989ad
(cherry picked from commit 6780cd74a0a6c894215f68870a033fc7349167e6)

commit_message:
Fix typos in ec2 credential policies

There was a trailing s in two of these policies and it caused the policy
names to mismatch, which causes confusion with the rendered policy files
and potentially causes uses with deprecation logic.

Change-Id: I54021986d17c57d7733d53caa4032c2767eaf25e
(cherry picked from commit 82da8824df0f56ef4e137805bf32d647cef1ea59)

commit_message:
Fix typo in identity provider policies

This cause the sample generated policy file to alias the old name with
the new policy name, which isn't needed since we're not renaming these
policies at all and it was likely a typo.

Conflicts:
      keystone/common/policies/identity_provider.py
      In later releases the deprecation parameters were moved up to the
      deprecated options and not in the DocumentedRule defaults.

Change-Id: Idfd9adbbe800bbc21814d94002a2b61524cce28a
(cherry picked from commit c10d5c88ef40e63d4dfefb792d6c3d68acd72dd9)

commit_message:
Fix typos in application credential policies

We updated these policies when we introduces system scope and default
roles, but the policy names accidentally changed, which makes the policy
files render with an alias because oslo.policy thinks the names are
changing.

Change-Id: I1121f1abe769ee83ffc285103a95ee95540ce727
(cherry picked from commit 60e898c47038667e66a54e0a9a6cd7b91e115f55)

subject: nova: Ensure each compute uses a unique iSCSI initiator
messages: [{'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-10-07 08:42:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-10-07 09:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-10-07 16:27:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-07 08:42:19.000000000', 'message': 'nova: Ensure each compute uses a unique iSCSI initiator

The current initiator name embedded in our CI images is not unique at
present and can often cause failures during live migrations with
attached volumes. This change ensures the name is unique by running
iscsi-iname again and overwriting the existing name.

We could potentially do this during the image build process itself but
given that devstack systems are not supposed to be multi-purpose this
should be safe to do during the devstack run.

Closes-Bug: #1945983
Change-Id: I9ed26a17858df96c04be9ae52bf2e33e023869a5
(cherry picked from commit 714826d1a27085ba2384ca495c876588d77f0d27)
'}]
commit_message:
nova: Ensure each compute uses a unique iSCSI initiator

The current initiator name embedded in our CI images is not unique at
present and can often cause failures during live migrations with
attached volumes. This change ensures the name is unique by running
iscsi-iname again and overwriting the existing name.

We could potentially do this during the image build process itself but
given that devstack systems are not supposed to be multi-purpose this
should be safe to do during the devstack run.

Closes-Bug: #1945983
Change-Id: I9ed26a17858df96c04be9ae52bf2e33e023869a5

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will

Change-Id: Idd89731aaf3138bb400182f5852a85ad23ea309d
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/wallaby

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/wallaby branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Idd89731aaf3138bb400182f5852a85ad23ea309d

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Allow for OCI manifests""

Add support for OCI manifests and includes a fix to handle the
schemaVersion 1 metadata which is used by the prometheus
containers upstream.

This reverts commit b2f76f8514baefb57e10c9a5562457b651ec29af.

Change-Id: I352cd33578eeb447d3a36cbca7767b1bfd5de7aa
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/812506
Related-Bug: #1860585

Add scenario001/004 coverage to image uploader changes

Because we fetch some external containers, we need to check them when we
make changes to the container image uploader bits.

commit d15d94300f257606c7b75dd9949d47288cb68b8d
Author: Victor Morales <chipahuac@hotmail.com>
Date:   Fri Aug 6 14:45:45 2021 -0700

    Remove unused imports in merge_yaml
    
    Dumper and Loader are classes seem to be loaded but not used in the merge_yaml
    file. This change removes them for reducing the number of lines.
    
    Change-Id: I87ef305903ab02226fcaa725ece622647d17811c

diff --git a/ansible/action_plugins/merge_yaml.py b/ansible/action_plugins/merge_yaml.py
index 929576693..a4170b3b2 100755
--- a/ansible/action_plugins/merge_yaml.py
+++ b/ansible/action_plugins/merge_yaml.py
@@ -21,13 +21,6 @@ import tempfile
 
 from yaml import dump
 from yaml import safe_load
-try:
-    from yaml import CDumper as Dumper  # noqa: F401
-    from yaml import CLoader as Loader  # noqa: F401
-except ImportError:
-    from yaml import Dumper  # noqa: F401
-    from yaml import Loader  # noqa: F401
-
 
 from ansible import constants
 from ansible import errors as ansible_errors"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-09-30 08:23:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2021-10-07 12:34:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-10-07 14:49:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

recheck'}]

subject: WIP: Lay down system persona test plumbing
messages:
[{'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-03-03 00:24:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-03-03 00:26:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-03-03 02:28:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-03-03 02:29:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-03-04 13:42:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

This was pulled out of a previous patch to make it more clear what exactly we're pursuing for Wallaby (project-specific personas).

We're hesitant to adopt system-scope right now because of glance's current authorization complexity and the short timeline between now and the Wallaby release.

We can pick this back up in Xena we have more time and we can re-use the existing protection tests to ensure we don't introduce regressions."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-03-04 13:42:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-10-07 19:11:15.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

I'm going to abandon this for now since we can revisit this when we have system-scope patches proposed to glance."}]

commit_message:
[WIP] [mariadb] Wait longer for WSREP sync

MariaDB 10.5 seems to need more time to sync WSREP.
This patch extends the grace period from 1 minute to 2 minutes and
puts less stress on the instances syncing WSREP by querying them
every 10 seconds as opposed to 6.

Change-Id: Ib52647ac4989f263b603a35962506bccad463500

subject: Try to use collectl instead of dstat
messages:
[{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-09-09 20:37:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-09-09 21:09:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-09-09 21:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-09-09 22:41:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-09-12 18:10:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I've also started thinking independently about adding a custom script to collect more useful information that would rely on neither of the solutions discussed so far (most likely just running ps appropriately). See the debian struggle in https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/789083
To this end, we could just drop dstat at all."}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-09-12 18:14:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Based on the fact we need EPEL for this and it's not really maintained anyway - I suggest we stay away from it as well. PCP is an overkill. Perhaps let's just go with some custom script I'll make up to debug Debian. I also don't think this is useful for dev installation of devstack. Most likely this was fudged in to get better insight in CI. I'll add it to QA meeting agenda."}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-10-07 18:23:17.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Abandoned as there doesn't seem to be a desire to use this tool instead of pcp."}]

commit_message:
Try to use collectl instead of dstat

Dstat is no longer maintained and the replacement for it (pcp) does not
install reliably. Try collectl as an alternative to these tools.

Closes-Bug: #1943184
Change-Id: Ie62fc039887defb5481ea522af3ba3b8c4010e9e

commit_message:
Implement project personas in custom octavia policy file

This change updates the default octavia policies to implement consistent
support for project personas (project-admin, project-member, and
project-reader) with other OpenStack services. The project-admin is
still considered a system administrator.

This behavior will change in future releases when more OpenStack
services adopt system-scope. At that time, we can go back to use the
default octavia policies or update them to use system scope.

Change-Id: I768fc10144a634ea6058b7b48a1862be9d70da79

commit_message:
[Train-only] Enable usage of memcache for keystone caching by default

The change e3413901cdb57a999e5e23d6d6a1830aef281658 disabled usage of
memcache backend unintentionally unless tls is enabled about memcache.

Change-Id: Id46c566242c4952fff5e288ed2e58d098491cf25

commit_message:
Bugfix for queries with multiple regex/pattern

This patch:
- Replaces AND with OR
- Adds new field suppress-notification

Reason:
For a query with multiple possible regexes the logstash query should be joined with OR and not AND.
And the reference query is not a genuine error,
so the bot should ignore it (suppress notification)
Probably this is why the bot is not commenting on patches even if Sova found a match.

Change-Id: I01e21a401e6d0fec948dfa9cf2eabe0311ee1e77

subject: Remove TripleO job
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-07 14:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-07 14:28:48.000000000', 'content': 'Hashtag added: puppet-tripleo-job'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-10-07 14:57:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Was there a wider discussion about this? It's not clear to me how changes in tripleo's release model should result in puppet modules no longer running a tripleo test in xena. An alternative would be to retain the current tests until a future point where breakage suggests tripleo no longer works with xena puppet modules.

Alex, what are your thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-07 15:10:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

we're dropping xena jobs but the tripleo jobs will remain on master until tripleo creates a release to match an openstack release"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-07 15:14:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Was there a wider discussion about this? It's not clear to me how changes in tripleo's release model should result in puppet modules no longer running a tripleo test in xena. An alternative would be to retain the current tests until a future point where breakage suggests tripleo no longer works with xena puppet modules.
> 
> Alex, what are your thoughts?

I've raised this topic during TripleO meeting last week but the all feedback I received there was that there is no interest in keeping TripleO job for Xena.
 https://meetings.opendev.org/meetings/tripleo/2021/tripleo.2021-09-28-14.00.log.html#l-66

We keep TripleO jobs in master so the compatibility with latest components will be kept.

It might be an option to keep jobs until they are broken but since there is nobody willing to keep it working it doesn't make much sense to keep jobs to detect any issue we will never fix."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-10-07 15:28:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Ack, makes sense. I have a persistent meeting conflict w/ tripleo's mtg, so it's good to know it was discussed."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2021-10-07 15:52:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

... because TripleO has switched to the independent release model and
its Xena release is not being created.

Change-Id: I2989272a1abb88122556ce2f15db7ce45a5f6dac
'}]
commit_message:
Remove TripleO job

... because TripleO has switched to the independent release model and
its Xena release is not being created.

Change-Id: I2989272a1abb88122556ce2f15db7ce45a5f6dac

Set launchpad bug Fix Released after adding comment

This adds a step in the launchpad interaction during a release to set
the bug task status to "Fix Released" for the series being released.

This cause the sample generated policy file to alias the old name with

Change-Id: Idfd9adbbe800bbc21814d94002a2b61524cce28a
(cherry picked from commit c10d5c88ef40e63d4dfefb792d6c3d68acd72dd9)

commit_message:
Fix typo in identity provider policies

This cause the sample generated policy file to alias the old name with
the new policy name, which isn't needed since we're not renaming these
policies at all and it was likely a typo.

Change-Id: Idfd9adbbe800bbc21814d94002a2b61524cce28a
(cherry picked from commit c10d5c88ef40e63d4dfefb792d6c3d68acd72dd9)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I29cbac4c2bf864d0739c488b1cd1f2de53316dac

commit_message:
Fix missing HORIZON_IMAGES_UPLOAD_MODE

The value as of current is treated as an expression
by horizon and will cause horizon to fail. The value
must be encapsulated with quotes so it is treated as
a string.

Closes-Bug: #1946277
Change-Id: I7a900d75ddffae88760d5965a1f9ac2f4277624f

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: Ibb32bfc43dc94a4c8deb41e2fb8ad93c4a9798a1

commit_message:
Exercise zaza tests

This is just to force the execution of the zaza tests with a patch that
refactors the ceph-fs test.

Do not merge.

Related-Bug: #1922195
Func-Test-PR: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/558
Change-Id: I21810cdd76a4b17ba1127f05d0807b09673cce72

subject: [Train-Only] Run Validations outside of mistral for the deployment
messages: [{'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-09-02 12:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-09-02 12:34:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-09-07 08:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-09-09 16:20:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-10-05 12:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-10-05 12:19:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16515, 'date': '2021-10-06 06:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-10-07 11:18:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-02 12:09:35.000000000', 'message': '[Train-Only] Run Validations outside of mistral for the deployment

In Train we still run Validation over Mistral for the Deployment which
is broken atm. Some pieces of the code has been dropped which make
the option --run-validations broken.

This review just call, like the undercloud-preflight Validations, the
Validation Framework instead of Mistral.

The results and output if some Validations failed will be easier to
debug, which is very difficult to do in the Mistral context.

Relared BZ:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1974353

Change-Id: I88d7d09c2f3cf1b5bb23bca3e1436ea8e2ca0d07

commit_message:
[Train-Only] Run Validations outside of mistral for the deployment

In Train we still run Validation over Mistral for the Deployment which
is broken atm. Some pieces of the code has been dropped which make
the option --run-validations broken.

This review just call, like the undercloud-preflight Validations, the
Validation Framework instead of Mistral.

The results and output if some Validations failed will be easier to
debug, which is very difficult to do in the Mistral context.

Relared BZ:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1974353

Change-Id: I88d7d09c2f3cf1b5bb23bca3e1436ea8e2ca0d07

commit_message:
Cinder matrix - Removal of Snapshot Attachment

This functionality is exposed via rpcapi (as a cinder backup
enhancement) and not the OpenStack Block Storage API. As such
it should be removed from the cinder support matrix.

Closes-Bug: #1934168
Change-Id: Icaca68a1be8151f4aa0c5a0a6baeb762492bd159

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Get manageable volumes fix

For a PowerMax volume to be manageable it can not be in
more than one storage group.  Filtering manageable volumes
list to remove all devices that are in more than one storage
group.

Change-Id: I3b480b8f6f01925357651a5c5b2145b249706415

commit_message:
Fix swift "Could not enable rsyncd" error

The inclusing of rsync::server as a tag makes it error out as follows:
2021-10-04T08:43:54.486557677+00:00 stderr F <13>Oct 4 08:43:54 puppet-user: Debug: Executing: '/usr/bin/systemctl is-enabled -- rsyncd'
2021-10-04T08:43:54.495188022+00:00 stderr F <13>Oct 4 08:43:54 puppet-user: Debug: Executing: '/usr/bin/systemctl unmask -- rsyncd'
2021-10-04T08:43:54.502673716+00:00 stderr F <13>Oct 4 08:43:54 puppet-user: Debug: Executing: '/usr/bin/systemctl enable -- rsyncd'
2021-10-04T08:43:54.511733823+00:00 stderr F <13>Oct 4 08:43:54 puppet-user: Error: Could not enable rsyncd:

Let's make sure we noop the service completely. I believe this started
showing on my CS9 env after https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-rsync/commit/8f6a96587106a6c5eaa9d923be8f85e710c82992

Tested and am able to deploy successfully again.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/812338

Closes-Bug: #1945962
Change-Id: Ic39c146ca23a1adb85bb0b3a2119c37176eba332

commit_message:
Add xena bundles

- add non-voting focal-xena bundle
- add non-voting impish-xena bundle
- remove groovy-victoria bundle
- align bundles and tests.yaml with designate charm mainly
  to allow test_nrpe_configured to be successful
- rebuild to pick up charm-helpers changes
- update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0

commit_message:
Use ovs constants from neutron-lib

Ovs constants were moved from neutron to neutron_lib some time ago.
This patch switches to use them from neutron-lib already.

This patch bumps min version of neutron-lib to 2.11 as it is version
which has those constants already.

It also fixes some small issue in grouping of imports.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/x/tap-as-a-service-tempest-plugin/+/797318

Change-Id: I7c44501b129673cc72fd48f3b508ea6278027762

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-10-07 09:00:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-21 13:20:12.000000000', 'message': "Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: Ic050f71a2e9a48e12e2549ffdf60223d2b0c601d
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: Ic050f71a2e9a48e12e2549ffdf60223d2b0c601d

commit_message:
Add mising overcloud-deploy tag to play

Since merge of [1], Downstream 16.2 job which test multiple overcloud
deploy is failing.

overcloud-deploy role is called but without tags. Adding missing tag.

Logs:-
~~~
primary | PLAY [Deploy the overcloud]
primary |
primary | TASK [ensure the deployment result has been read into memory]
~~~

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/770924

Change-Id: Ic57c64e258cf9951a36b39c49a3b351a45b98c48

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when the
requirements repository branches.

That facilitates tests continuing to use the upper-constraints list on
master until the requirements repository has a stable/xena branch.

Change-Id: I164d60b317ce6fb89d5ffdecf0bff5c76234ae6b
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when the
requirements repository branches.

That facilitates tests continuing to use the upper-constraints list on
master until the requirements repository has a stable/xena branch.

Change-Id: I164d60b317ce6fb89d5ffdecf0bff5c76234ae6b

commit_message:
Fix IncludeInExport allowed value validation

Newer iDRAC firmware has changed how it reports
IncludeInExport@Redfish.AllowableValues, no longer including
comma separated option. Although iDRAC violates AllowableValues
validation logic, need to work around this.

Change-Id: I21524bef52e32eb56c105bb57c8f846503a401f4
(cherry picked from commit 40f966c007cebe98225f0e61e2ebf5da43ae4cdd)

commit_message:
Add new metadata keys to the validation playbooks

This patch adds two new metadata keys to the validation playbooks:
- categories: A list of technical tags
- products: A list of targeted products (here mainly common)

This patch is also part of the Validation Metadata Evolution for the
Validations Framework.

Change-Id: Ie6b3a42a09292eadd4233b180132140052d89f09
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set growvols_args for all Controller roles

By default swift is deployed in the Controller, so grow the /srv to
50% of available disk space for swift object storage. (by default 100%
of remaining space is allocated to /var)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/812414
Change-Id: I7fd59e7ef1ce6eff5e67c158a84274667e9fc4ec

commit_message:
Add new metadata keys to the validation playbooks

This patch adds two new metadata keys to the validation playbooks:
- categories: A list of technical tags
- products: A list of targeted products (here mainly TripleO)

This patch is also part of the Validation Metadata Evolution for the
Validations Framework.

commit_message:
Support setting growvols_args in topology_map

Some roles (Controller with swift, and ObjectStorage) will need the
/srv volume to grow to store swift content. This allows custom
growvols_args to be specified on a per-role basis using the
topology_map.

Change-Id: I87836cef3b8815223ae0b038d6e295bccaa3ee65

commit_message:
Enable keystone_authtoken/memcach_use_advanced_pool for Sahara

Sahara was removed during Wallaby cycle and because of that it was not
updated when commit 09bcacd25a7217ce66eec10ccfda4847e6d3d87a was
backported from Wallaby to Victoria.
This change updates the Sahara templates to have consistent definition
with the other services.

Conflicts:
	deployment/sahara/sahara-base.yaml

Related-Bug: #1931047
Change-Id: Idb9a209b2651c1ff03c3ccaa14f4976a9f267e99
(cherry picked from commit 59599a86d7cd69240195f4455d8fe5e76c9ace51)
(cherry picked from commit 3b5628babca75abb59f0a381eebfd0a03dfb1160)

commit_message:
Fix l-c and requirements job

- update grpcio in requirements.txt
- update cffi, greenlet and grpcio in l-c to avoid problems
when trying to build the wheels.
- adds .stestr to gitignore

Change-Id: Id2d1c3ea60c33803a35082b9064ccba982b014a7

commit_message:
Use ansible-role-pki to generate SSL certificates

Supports two scenarios:

1) variables defined in defaults/main.yml are sufficient to create
a root/intermediate CA certificate for mariadb when this role
is used outside openstack-ansible.

2) when:

openstack_pki_dir
openstack_pki_setup_host
openstack_pki_authorities
openstack_pki_service_intermediate_cert_name

are defined, an external CA already created on the deploy host
with a previous run of ansible-role-pki will be used as the CA.

Server certificates for the galera instances are created from the
data in galera_pki_certificates in both situations

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-role-pki/+/807771
Change-Id: I72738e4f8bd2233dedbed4428baafd4436de84b5

commit_message:
Fix the functional-tips tox environment

The egg for the keystoneauth project is actually called keystonauth1.
Seems newer pip actually complains about the difference and fails.

Change-Id: I1602832d33cd467745a03b36c9b1545cd069ba1d

subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-10-07 10:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-07 08:28:04.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iccfba33f970e6c5babe22c7bc88d6c15bf0427d2
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iccfba33f970e6c5babe22c7bc88d6c15bf0427d2

(2 comments)

Not blocking, but we should have a clear description of the module in the documentation section instead of comment and git description.

Especially, because that module doesn't create the module file, only check that the version is as expected, which was, at first, a bit confusing to me - I kept wondering  " but what create that file? ".

So a detailed doc, describing the exact scope of this module and what is expected/not expected would be nice IMHO.

Beside that look good to me and big +1 for the tests :)'}, {'account_id': 8297, 'date': '2020-08-28 09:09:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35:

Maybe this could have be a part of the Enforce module as well, but not sure as it's actually not only checking but can change the "version" of the module.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-09-01 10:59:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2020-09-01 14:29:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 35: Workflow-1

After @Emilien's comment, I digged a little bit more into the dnf module functionality and it looks like we don't really need a role for this. We can solve it in tht by adding the following task:

    - name: iterating over each module/stream passed in tripleo_stream_enable
      dnf:
        name: "@{{ item.module }}:{{ item.stream }}"
      become: true
      loop: "{{ tripleo_stream_enable }}"

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-06 16:01:04.000000000', 'message': "Add role tripleo_stream_enable.

This generic role allows us setting a specific stream passed in the
parameter tripleo_stream_enable_stream for the module specified in
the parameter tripleo_stream_enable_module.

If the module isn't present in the system, the role will fail. Otherwise
it will first check the current stream configured. If the stream configured
matches the one from tripleo_stream_enable_stream nothing else will
be done, if not it will disable the current stream, enable the new
one and run distro-sync to synchronize the content to the newly
configured stream.

Related-Bug: #1890631
Resolves: rhbz#1866479

Change-Id: I36cb46f6eae8c8e55dca1d165d57119bea897a81

This generic role allows us setting a specific stream passed in the
parameter tripleo_stream_enable, being a list of two values, the module

If the module isn't present in the system, the role will fail. Otherwise
it will first check the current stream configured. If the stream configured
matches the one from tripleo_stream_enable.stream nothing else will
be done, if not it will disable the current stream and enable the new

commit_message:
Add role tripleo_stream_enable.

This generic role allows us setting a specific stream passed in the
parameter tripleo_stream_enable, being a list of two values, the module
we want to change and the stream to set.

If the module isn't present in the system, the role will fail. Otherwise
it will first check the current stream configured. If the stream configured
matches the one from tripleo_stream_enable.stream nothing else will
be done, if not it will disable the current stream and enable the new
one. Once all the entries from tripleo_stream_enable are processed, a
distro-sync opereation is run to synchronize the content to the newly
configured streams, only if some of the streams were changed.

Related-Bug: #1890631
Resolves: rhbz#1866479

Change-Id: I36cb46f6eae8c8e55dca1d165d57119bea897a81

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I9114dc407e2880feeb69389a651b010384b8038a

commit_message:
nova: Release Ussuri 21.2.3

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 21.2.2..HEAD
5ded5d8050 [stable-only] Set lower-constraints job as non-voting
0997043f45 address open redirect with 3 forward slashes
fa0ad18619 Fix 1vcpu error with multiqueue and vif_type=tap
d43b88a334 Reduce mocking in test_reject_open_redirect for compat
719e651e6b Reject open redirection in the console proxy
59249697bf Initialize global data separately and run_once in WSGI app init
91314f7fbb Move 'check-cherry-picks' test to gate, n-v check
b96f93ed86 Honor [neutron]http_retries in the manual client
637402eec7 guestfs: With libguestfs >= v1.41.1 decode returned bytes to string
8a858eca55 Dynamically archive FK related records in archive_deleted_rows
37cff3c74d Add functional test for bug 1837995
a8624cdaa2 Centralize sqlite FK constraint enforcement

Change-Id: Iea66a77aa41f49e4e57351cbf2a0fa2634d88fb5

The error appears in the following stanza:

  IRONIC_DEPLOY_DRIVER: redfish
          IRONIC_ENABLED_HARDWARE_TYPES: redfish

          # result and makes this job VERY sensitive to heavy disk IO of the
          # underlying hypervisor/cloud.

commit_message:
Yoga: Change default boot mode to uefi

Change the default boot mode to UEFI, as discussed during the end
of the Wallaby release cycle and previously agreed a very long time
ago by the Ironic community.

Change-Id: I6d735604d56d1687f42d0573a2eed765cbb08aec

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/xena.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I8e1cce7a779fd726f48ef15bbf25de54894ac118

commit_message:
Add TLS support to services using memcached

This patch enables TLS connections to memcached in services which
support it. Specifically the settings are consumed by swift's internal
memcached client through puppet-swift; or oslo.cache, through
puppet-ceilometer, puppet-keystone, puppet-nova, puppet-heat
and puppet-oslo.

NOTE(moguimar): Squashing fixes proposed by Rabi Mirsha in order to
optimize conditions.

Squashes:
- Optimize conditions for TLS support
  (cherry picked from commit cc5eb81771cb0016f7c4ac02d17627474e210597)

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/774227
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/775616
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/784211
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/779926
Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/775649
Change-Id: Ic77ed56c32c7071ce126a1528030094b97894653
(cherry picked from commit 1ceb521805875b41ebfafb1ff7a862df4df6fd16)

[{'created': '2021-10-07 08:28:35.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifb87a7256775335fb953e2a8cf0f8d49c4e6a578
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifb87a7256775335fb953e2a8cf0f8d49c4e6a578

commit_message:
Update master for stable/xena

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/xena.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I25a9fa62f79f797eb9cd0e68c1155bab5423b3d5

commit_message:
Provision networks before overcloud deploy

We add network_isolation_args[1] if network_provision is
false. This would create issues with ephemeral heat
overcloud deploy  with --disable-protected-resource-types.

Let's provision networks before overcloud deploy to be
consistent with other featuresets.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/blob/master/roles/overcloud-deploy/tasks/pre-deploy.yml#L15-L17

Change-Id: Ib779207f6aa90484ff4a0e49262b8335ac9d953d

commit_message:
Allow configuring secure RBAC in nova

Adding new parameter EnforceSecureRbac to support for project
persona of secure RBAC in nova-api.

To make the secure RBAC work, 'oslo_policy/enforce_new_defaults' and
'oslo_policy/enforce_scope' are also required to be enabled with
'enforce_secure_rbac' in nova.

Partially Implements: blueprint secure-rbac

Change-Id: Ie03e3e7855563331774a85cef6cc36e414e0a260

[{'created': '2021-10-04 08:52:05.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Set NB/SB "connection" inactivity probe

For each NB/SB databases, set the inactivity probe timeout value on
the Neutron configured connection register.

Neutron connects to the NB/SB databases with the value defined in
"ovn_nb_connection"/"ovn_sb_connection" config parameters, with the
format:
- tcp:IP:PORT
- ssl:IP:PORT
- unix:socket_file

The connection register "target" column has the following format:
- ptcp:PORT:IP
- pssl:PORT:IP
- punix:socket_file

    neutron/common/ovn/utils.py

commit_message:
[OVN] Set NB/SB "connection" inactivity probe

For each NB/SB databases, set the inactivity probe timeout value on
the Neutron configured connection register.

Neutron connects to the NB/SB databases with the value defined in
"ovn_nb_connection"/"ovn_sb_connection" config parameters, with the
format:
- tcp:IP:PORT
- ssl:IP:PORT
- unix:socket_file

The connection register "target" column has the following format:
- ptcp:PORT:IP
- pssl:PORT:IP
- punix:socket_file

Conflicts:
    neutron/common/ovn/utils.py
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py
    neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py

Closes-Bug: #1935842
Change-Id: If82ff2c92b8bec18ae3e895ce19a65cfeed9c90d
(cherry picked from commit 28f3017a90ecec6208aef9696cd7947972ec17d8)
(cherry picked from commit f8aefd600b164f866b4a1dde25ae3459797b87d3)
(cherry picked from commit f6eda4f96546e017ac3986a113dd2f5b227a9c79)

commit_message:
Add xena bundles

- add non-voting impish-xena bundle
- add non-voting focal-xena bundle
- add non-voting focal-wallaby bundle
- update bionic bundles to replace eoan image with focal
- rebuild to pick up charm-helpers changes
- update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0
- drop minimal mirror from tests until
  https://pad.lv/1933966 is fixed

Change-Id: I9b38c0da71229fbc1a70849d8fcae450e8983b21
Related-Bug: #1933966

commit_message:
Allow configuring secure RBAC in placement

Adding new parameter EnforceSecureRbac to support for project
persona of secure RBAC in placement-api.

To make the secure RBAC work, 'oslo_policy/enforce_new_defaults' and
'oslo_policy/enforce_scope' are also required to be enabled with
'enforce_secure_rbac' in placement.

Partially Implements: blueprint secure-rbac

Change-Id: I9862ad83b3e12012be01e49cc1c16b505c7c40cf

/me dusts off the same conversation about puppet versioning again

We only switch major versions between releases as 19.x would be the xena series for the development cycle.  You'd be expected to use the latest one from 19.x with xena as folks generally aren't using the milestone versions except for during development.

The versions are correct as listed"}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-10-07 08:06:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1
> 
> /me dusts off the same conversation about puppet versioning again
> 
> We only switch major versions between releases as 19.x would be the xena series for the development cycle.  You'd be expected to use the latest one from 19.x with xena as folks generally aren't using the milestone versions except for during development.
> 
> The versions are correct as listed

Cool, thanks for the confirmation, as usual."}]

commit_message:
Remove non-working code after method return.

Delete duplicate return code.

While adding return of a new Member type, the existing return code part is not deleted.

Note the code in fakes.py in the below commit where these codes were added.
- Project: python-openstackclient
- The commit: 60e7c51df4cf061ebbb435a959ad63c7d3a296bf

Change-Id: Iae44770a784732991962cd38472095f76ab2543f

[{'created': '2017-10-04 03:16:06.000000000', 'message': 'Remove cache dirs from the services (take 2)

commit_message:
Remove cache dirs from the services (take 2)

PKI tokens have been actively deprecated from keystone and there are
deprecations being emitted from keystonemiddleware. Because of this we
no longer need an auth cache directory in the services where the PKI
certifcates used to be stored.

Add configure_auth_token_middleware_v2 that does not have the
"signing_dir" argument, convert existing callers and remove the
creation and use of all these AUTH_CACHE directories.  Add a
deprecation notice for plugins to update as appropriate.

(This reverts commit 1f82f43016f5e3c51560c8b7c0b9c07350731f6c.)

Change-Id: I114a966cb8205d6fc1c62b4898eefddd1a1ce2e7

subject: Remove pki and pkiz token format

Share your thoughts.'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-10-06 09:21:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 5:
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> This could break existing initiators on restacking, no? I suggest we either do this for infra itself only or make devstack track whether it has already set this (using a helper file for example). Share your thoughts.

As I said in the commit, I can't imagine anyone is using an existing initiator within a devstack env before stacking or restacking. Within the context of the deployment any prior use of the initiator is obviously removed during a restack so that also shouldn't be an issue IMHO.

If it later transpires that we do have users who need to retain the original initiator name then we can always add a variable to control when this takes place, defaulting to True for the main use case that they can disable."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2021-10-06 16:13:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-10-06 17:11:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
nova: Ensure each compute uses a unique iSCSI initiator

The current initiator name embedded in our CI images is not unique at
present and can often cause failures during live migrations with
attached volumes. This change ensures the name is unique by running
iscsi-iname again and overwriting the existing name.

We could potentially do this during the image build process itself but
given that devstack systems are not supposed to be multi-purpose this
should be safe to do during the devstack run.

Closes-Bug: #1945983
Change-Id: I9ed26a17858df96c04be9ae52bf2e33e023869a5

commit_message:
remove using containers-prepare-parameter.yaml

1. Stop using DockerInsecureRegistryAddress from
   containers-prepare-parameter.yaml
2. Instead, use:
   'openstack stack environment show qe-Cloud-0'

Co-authored-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8b30574fcc769b4ee39a0c24f3a5a982b80f6c0a
(cherry picked from commit 8492bf8e35248adc08b95572ced3319112148fdb)

commit_message:
[validation_init] add new metadata keys in the playbook template

This patch adds two new metadata keys to the playbook creation step when
initializing a new Validation:
- categories: A list of technical tags or domains
- products: A list of targeted products (here mainly TripleO)

This patch is also part of the Validation Metadata Evolution for the
Validations Framework.

Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia41a0e05b1074d72bfcc23b43d61f65a43758fe7
(cherry picked from commit d691f30633f4b284ab811ba95c0b5f26a45f565b)

commit_message:
Add support for verify steps

This change adds support for verify steps in Ironic. Verify steps
allow executing actions on transition from "verifying" to "managable"
state and can perform actions such as cleaning BMC job queue or
resetting the BMC on supported platforms. Verify steps are similar
to deploy and clean steps, just simpler.

Story: 2009025
Task: 42751
Change-Id: Iee27199a0315b8609e629bac272998c28274802b

commit_message:
haproxy: Use healthcheck middleware to monitor service availability

This change makes that haproxy monitors service availability by sending
HTTP request which is responsed by healthcheck middleware, to ensure
that backend api can respond to requests.

Conflicts:
	manifests/haproxy.pp

Change-Id: Idbfe6a8e110ec24d9fe64e43d82772bb05fa00ba
(cherry picked from commit 46024cd5bff76bd4c4c4b5cda9bf555fa145c846)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 08:49:09.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Set NB/SB "connection" inactivity probe

For each NB/SB databases, set the inactivity probe timeout value on
the Neutron configured connection register.

Neutron connects to the NB/SB databases with the value defined in
"ovn_nb_connection"/"ovn_sb_connection" config parameters, with the
format:
- tcp:IP:PORT
- ssl:IP:PORT
- unix:socket_file

The connection register "target" column has the following format:
- ptcp:PORT:IP
- pssl:PORT:IP
- punix:socket_file

Conflicts:
    neutron/common/ovn/utils.py
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py
    neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py

commit_message:
[OVN] Set NB/SB "connection" inactivity probe

For each NB/SB databases, set the inactivity probe timeout value on
the Neutron configured connection register.

Neutron connects to the NB/SB databases with the value defined in
"ovn_nb_connection"/"ovn_sb_connection" config parameters, with the
format:
- tcp:IP:PORT
- ssl:IP:PORT
- unix:socket_file

The connection register "target" column has the following format:
- ptcp:PORT:IP
- pssl:PORT:IP
- punix:socket_file

Conflicts:
    neutron/common/ovn/utils.py
    neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py
    neutron/tests/functional/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/test_mech_driver.py

Closes-Bug: #1935842
Change-Id: If82ff2c92b8bec18ae3e895ce19a65cfeed9c90d
(cherry picked from commit 28f3017a90ecec6208aef9696cd7947972ec17d8)
(cherry picked from commit f8aefd600b164f866b4a1dde25ae3459797b87d3)

commit_message:
Add missing oslo.db options

This change ensures that options of oslo.db library are rendered into
barbican.conf generated by `tox -e genconfig`, because these options
are required to set up database connections.

[{'created': '2021-09-22 22:17:38.000000000', 'message': 'Write network_data.json metadata to config-dirve

cloud-init will use fall-back config when network metadata
is *not* present. This works fine if the first NIC on the node is
connected to a network with DHCP. But, when the first NIC is not
used for provisioning, cloud-init will only write a fallback config
for the first NIC. This causes the provisioned node to be unavailable.

Extend instance configuration to include network metadata so that
cloud-init can configure node networking.

commit_message:
Write network_data.json metadata to config-dirve

cloud-init will use fall-back config when network metadata
is *not* present. This works fine if the first NIC on the node is
connected to a network with DHCP. But, when the first NIC is not
used for provisioning, cloud-init will only write a fallback config
for the first NIC. This causes the provisioned node to be unavailable.

Extend instance configuration to include network metadata so that
cloud-init can configure node networking.

Story: 2009238
Task: 43378
Change-Id: I70f1a972a6d5a0398cd348f00308957386d66067
(cherry picked from commit f98dfa61c1d7475b81c20dabbf2c74198c38c793)

commit_message:
Write network_data.json metadata to config-dirve

cloud-init will use fall-back config when network metadata
is *not* present. This works fine if the first NIC on the node is
connected to a network with DHCP. But, when the first NIC is not
used for provisioning, cloud-init will only write a fallback config
for the first NIC. This causes the provisioned node to be unavailable.

Extend instance configuration to include network metadata so that

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-01 22:14:27.000000000', 'message': "Helm 3 - Fix Job Labels

If labels are not specified on a Job, kubernetes defaults them
to include the labels of their underlying Pod template. Helm 3
injects metadata into all resources [0] including a
`app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: Helm` label. Thus when kubernetes
sees a Job's labels they are no longer empty and thus do not get
defaulted to the underlying Pod template's labels. This is a
problem since Job labels are depended on by

commit_message:
Helm 3 - Fix Job Labels

If labels are not specified on a Job, kubernetes defaults them
to include the labels of their underlying Pod template. Helm 3
injects metadata into all resources [0] including a
`app.kubernetes.io/managed-by: Helm` label. Thus when kubernetes
sees a Job's labels they are no longer empty and thus do not get
defaulted to the underlying Pod template's labels. This is a
problem since Job labels are depended on by
- Armada pre-upgrade delete hooks
- Armada wait logic configurations
- kubernetes-entrypoint dependencies

Thus for each Job template this adds labels matching the
underlying Pod template to retain the same labels that were
present with Helm 2.

[0]: https://github.com/helm/helm/pull/7649

Change-Id: Ib5a7eb494fb776d74e1edc767b9522b02453b19d

commit_message:
Fix typo in identity provider policies

This cause the sample generated policy file to alias the old name with
the new policy name, which isn't needed since we're not renaming these
policies at all and it was likely a typo.

Change-Id: Idfd9adbbe800bbc21814d94002a2b61524cce28a

commit_message:
[stable-only] Pin virtualenv and setuptools

Setuptools 58.0 (bundled in virtualenv 20.8) breaks the installation of
decorator 3.4.0. So this patch pins virtualenv to avoid the break.

As the used 'require' feature was introduced in tox in version 3.2 [1],
the required minversion has to be bumped, too.

[1] https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-requires

Conflicts:
    tox.ini

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict is because change
Ie1a0cbd82a617dbcc15729647218ac3e9cd0e5a9 (Stop testing Python 2) is
not in Train.

Change-Id: I26b2a14e0b91c0ab77299c3e4fbed5f7916fe8cf
(cherry picked from commit b27f8e9adfcf2db3c83722c42e055ba5065ad06e)

commit_message:
Don't write <stack_name>-passwords.conf

We don't need to keep writing undercloud-passwords.conf
as tripleo-<stack_name>-passwords.yaml is the
source of old passwords since rocky.

Change-Id: I527d752fbf0713b93354f61acdaf35db8c60f068
(cherry picked from commit 629945fdecd0fb8ba5346d474b693e6b8b23645a)

commit_message:
Expose skip list mechanism via the CLI

The skip list feature was available only via the API, this patch
allow the user to pass a file with the list of the validations
which he wants to skip during the run, example:

check-ram: hosts: all
  reason: Wrong ram value
  lp: https://lp.fake.net
check-cpu: hosts: undercloud
  reason: Unstable validation
  lp: https://lp.fake.net
Change-Id: I04059f9339085e0dcef1f018cad1be511ee7d3c7

commit_message:
Disable TraceEnable to satisfy security scanners

Disable TraceEnable to satisfy security scanners
and since this is not needed on the image serve
service, no features will be affected.

Change-Id: I25242f740af7fe817bb34eb8ab70ef5617f559db
(cherry picked from commit 88797eb5a7a8d78e5680ea4a7069cbb70ee2dcaf)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-09-22 15:23:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Please see my comments on https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/781571/23/ for the potential issues on those defaults. Historically glance default policies have been wide open and not suitable for production use due to testing reasons. While some defaults have been pushed more restrictive direction they still do not reflect reasonable production environment.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-09-24 14:47:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> Please see my comments on https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/781571/23/ for the potential issues on those defaults. Historically glance default policies have been wide open and not suitable for production use due to testing reasons. While some defaults have been pushed more restrictive direction they still do not reflect reasonable production environment.

Hi Erno,

Thank you for review, I have replied to your comments on above patch.
Even though earlier our policies were wide open we had some read only checks in authorization layer or db layer (mainly image mutability check) which was restricting those APIs.

As now we are enforcing the policy checks in API layer and avoiding enforcing read only checks later, we have constructed these new policy rules by considering those read only checks to maintain the backward compatibility.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-09-28 13:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-10-06 13:01:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@Erno, following up on this to see if Abhishek answered your questions.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-10-06 13:54:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I agree with Abhi, and with the comment added here. I'm not sure I see what there is to argue about the content of the comment. This is about policy defaults and personas, and thus I think it's fine and correct. If there are still issues with the policy defaults, we should certainly take note and work on them, but not here (obviously)."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-10-06 13:58:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-10-06 14:41:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-10-06 14:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-06 14:42:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2021-10-06 14:45:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add a note about how glance currently supports project personas

This commit leaves the generated default policies for glance alone since
they implement project personas. We don't need to do anything special to
override those policies and get that behavior.

Leaving them defined in the environment for completeness.

Change-Id: I414760f8e50e767035fbedc4f8ea7c7e4d166f8e

commit_message:
Implement project personas in custom designate policy file

This commit updates the default policies in enable-secure-rbac.yaml to
implement consistent project personas (project-admin, project-member,
and project-reader) with other OpenStack services. The project-admin is
still considered a system administrator.

This behavior will change in future releases when more OpenStack
services adopt system-scope. At that time, we can go back to using the
default designate policies.

Change-Id: I108af0be37ab77510777168bb689b9d4718bc26a

FTR: 12:55:19 PM - mschuppert: bogdando the RBAC ones get set via NovaApiPolicies param. NovaRestrictLiveMigration gets merged into if enabled. so NovaRestrictLiveMigration wins.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-09-28 13:16:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-09-28 13:19:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> 
> > Patch Set 1:
> > 
> > does it play nicely with other overrides, like https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/802027/7/deployment/nova/nova-api-container-puppet.yaml and for other modules, based on https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/+/802305/ facility?
> 
> FTR: 12:55:19 PM - mschuppert: bogdando the RBAC ones get set via NovaApiPolicies param. NovaRestrictLiveMigration gets merged into if enabled. so NovaRestrictLiveMigration wins.

Ok - interesting. I didn't realize there were specific options for adjusting certain policies in nova.

If someone is using this template, how likely is it that they will need to set NovaRestrictLiveMigration? I think we're setting that that policy to be admin-only. Is it the exception to the rule to open that policy up to other users?"}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-09-28 13:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-09-28 13:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2021-09-28 13:41:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > > does it play nicely with other overrides, like https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/802027/7/deployment/nova/nova-api-container-puppet.yaml and for other modules, based on https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-openstacklib/+/802305/ facility?
> > 
> > FTR: 12:55:19 PM - mschuppert: bogdando the RBAC ones get set via NovaApiPolicies param. NovaRestrictLiveMigration gets merged into if enabled. so NovaRestrictLiveMigration wins.
> 
> Ok - interesting. I didn't realize there were specific options for adjusting certain policies in nova.
> 
> If someone is using this template, how likely is it that they will need to set NovaRestrictLiveMigration? I think we're setting that that policy to be admin-only. Is it the exception to the rule to open that policy up to other users?

commit_message:
Implement project personas in custom nova policy file

This commit updates the default nova policies in enable-secure-rbac.yaml
to implement consistent project personas (project-admin, project-member,
and project-reader) with other OpenStack services. The project-admin is
still considered a system administrator, even though the default
policies in nova upstream use system scope.

This behavior will change in future releases when more OpenStack
services adopt system scope, which is a Yoga community goal. At that
time, we can drop custom policy overrides all together and get
consistent behavior with the defaults upstream.

Change-Id: Ia6681703a9ca000b2fa712ee3a9906f05909d24a

commit_message:
Add --trusted-image-cert option for server create

this already exists for server rebuild, but was missing for server
create.

This option is supported from Compute API version >= 2.63, and is only
available for servers booted directly from images (not from volumes,
not from snapshots, and not from images first converted to volumes).

Additionally, this patch removes mentions of
OS_TRUSTED_IMAGE_CERTIFICATE_IDS env var from similar option help string
in server rebuild command as it is not actually implemented yet.

Change-Id: I4e9faea05c499bd91034d1d284c44fdcc8e18db5

commit_message:
Fix MAX_TIMEOUT value for listener

In the database, timeout_client_data, timeout_member_connect,
timeout_member_data, timeout_tcp_inspect have an integer type with
a maximum size of 2147483647. Now MAX_TIMEOUT in API does not exceed
this value and is equal to 24 days (2073600000 seconds).

Story: 2009193
Task: 43248
Change-Id: I990b6af1ff880b25e54f6c41ae0c966007f3f098
(cherry picked from commit 3a8f056306bba4502639bfc89752d8a48d694e7f)
(cherry picked from commit 9a25a643e2cb544bd9b4993a126a74ecc482ac2d)

commit_message:
Software RAID: Call udev_settle before creation

This patch fixes a race during software RAID creation:
we create the partition with parted, the kernel then
notifies udev, but we need to wait for udevd to create
the device files before calling mdadm to create the
md device.

Credits to jcosmao for finding this.

Change-Id: I642f28acc351cf50263e37dfbc8468bf59de2cc5
(cherry picked from commit 9d707e9f4bab40109b7e29df2136e86d65325ea3)

commit_message:
Software RAID: Call udev_settle before creation

This patch fixes a race during software RAID creation:
we create the partition with parted, the kernel then
notifies udev, but we need to wait for udevd to create
the device files before calling mdadm to create the
md device.

Credits to jcosmao for finding this.

Change-Id: I642f28acc351cf50263e37dfbc8468bf59de2cc5

Update htk requirements

This change updates the helm-toolkit path in each chart as part
of the move to helm v3. This is due to a lack of helm serve.

Change-Id: I011e282616bf0b5a5c72c1db185c70d8c721695e

commit_message:

Jenkins gate jobs are failing with ssl error[1].
Disabling certificate verification to fix the issue.

[{'created': '2021-09-17 16:11:46.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5791d335c70eb70af0f5a52190a60bb6da7dc951
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I5791d335c70eb70af0f5a52190a60bb6da7dc951

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing from stable branches

This topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to test
lower constraints [1]. As decided in horizon weekly meeting in
the past[2], stable branches will drop the lower-constraints job from CI.

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html
[2]https://meetings.opendev.org/irclogs/%23openstack-meeting-alt/%23openstack-meeting-alt.2021-03-24.log.html#t2021-03-24T15:12:58

Change-Id: I30caf0b6658d07bf25163514ef4eb7c7f0802af1

subject: Fix typo error in listing server's column name
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-08-28 07:23:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix typo error in listing server's column name

openstack server list -c "Created At" command doesn't work
because the wrong variable was used here.

When we receive resp data, Created At data is saved with
the name "created". But in "server.py", we append columns
as created_at. So it seems to print an empty table.

Story: 2009149
Task: 43112
Change-Id: I06de6903d5cc427a8b0fdcd168fec47192f4365b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix typo error in listing server's column name

openstack server list -c "Created At" command doesn't work
because the wrong variable was used here.

When we receive resp data, Created At data is saved with
the name "created". But in "server.py", we append columns
as created_at. So it seems to print an empty table.

Story: 2009149
Task: 43112
Change-Id: I06de6903d5cc427a8b0fdcd168fec47192f4365b

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-21 22:11:57.000000000', 'message': "Rely on ceph.conf settings when cinder backup pool is created

Ceph adds the osd pool default size option on ceph.conf via [1];
this means we don't need to specify the size of this pool if
the same value (same variable) is used (CEPH_REPLICAS).
This change is an attempt of removing the size setting, relying
on the implicit declaration of the value provided by ceph.conf.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/blob/master/devstack/lib/ceph#L425

Change-Id: I5fa2105ceb3b97a4e38926d76c1e4028f1108d4a
(cherry picked from commit 448db9ec41930d13a785c553e09a34417507f594)
"}]
commit_message:
Rely on ceph.conf settings when cinder backup pool is created

Ceph adds the osd pool default size option on ceph.conf via [1];
this means we don't need to specify the size of this pool if
the same value (same variable) is used (CEPH_REPLICAS).
This change is an attempt of removing the size setting, relying
on the implicit declaration of the value provided by ceph.conf.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/devstack-plugin-ceph/blob/master/devstack/lib/ceph#L425

Change-Id: I5fa2105ceb3b97a4e38926d76c1e4028f1108d4a
(cherry picked from commit 448db9ec41930d13a785c553e09a34417507f594)
