commit_message:
[Functional] Wait for the initial state of ha router before test

In functional tests of the HA and DVR HA routers, when e.g.
failover is tested, we should always wait for routers to be in the
expected initial state (primary or backup) before router failover
will actually be done.
Without that, we may hit race condition when initial router's state
is enqueued but not processed yet and then state will be changed thus
no any action will be performed by L3 agent and test may fail.

Additionally in that patch there is "master" instead of "primary" used
for router state.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py

Closes-Bug: #1939507
Change-Id: Ibd8f78fc822b04965c6a79b57b13be364934f64f
(cherry picked from commit b8ef8e722af761dd394064ab70e159aa05639e56)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-05 09:38:35.000000000', 'message': 'Software RAID: Call udev_settle before creation

This patch fixes a race during software RAID creation:
we create the partition with parted, the kernel then
notifies udev, but we need to wait for udevd to create
the device files before calling mdadm to create the
md device.

Credits to jcosmao for finding this.

Change-Id: I642f28acc351cf50263e37dfbc8468bf59de2cc5
'}, {'created': '2021-10-05 09:43:39.000000000', 'message': 'Software RAID: Call udev_settle before creation

This patch fixes a race during software RAID creation:
we create the partition with parted, the kernel then
notifies udev, but we need to wait for udevd to create
the device files before calling mdadm to create the
md device.

Credits to jcosmao for finding this.

Change-Id: I642f28acc351cf50263e37dfbc8468bf59de2cc5
'}]
commit_message:
Software RAID: Call udev_settle before creation

This patch fixes a race during software RAID creation:
we create the partition with parted, the kernel then
notifies udev, but we need to wait for udevd to create
the device files before calling mdadm to create the
md device.

Credits to jcosmao for finding this.

Change-Id: I642f28acc351cf50263e37dfbc8468bf59de2cc5

commit_message:
Fix CentOS 7 image building

Amphora image building may fail with alternate HAProxy packages.
This patch fixes that issue such that if the "haproxy" service is
not present it will not fail the build.

Change-Id: I37976efde41fa24475ceaf8928b881f4cfd8ef14
Story: 2008356
Task: 41261

commit_message:
[www] Correct location of Xena files

In change Ied5cb4a103569fa7159d8556c6baadac0c0b5a09, we stated that we
were adding Xena index pages. However, we actually added the Yoga pages.
Correct this mistake.

Change-Id: Ic2a55c22b3aae19e5fe6c0df58e9a053938edd83
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

results from previous builds and thus saves time.

commit_message:
[CI] Stop adding the DROP workaround

Since Wallaby, we default to disabling Docker's iptables
management, thus making the code being removed here obsolete.

Change-Id: Ieb7774f2380a811070aea27964a39e4c8cb02083

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-22 12:28:46.000000000', 'message': '[tox] Optimise docs actions

This makes tox actions against docs better suited for iterative
work (rise-rinse-repeat).

- doc envs do not require k-a to be (re)installed (skip_install)

- this change preserves doctrees and builds between runs (no rm,
  no -a, no -E); this can be overridden e.g. like this:

    tox -e docs -- -E

  this does not apply to releasenotes which never refresh without
  -E, so this change keeps -E for releasenotes (-E implies -a);
  this contributes the majority of performance gain for iterative
  work

- this change allows extra posargs to be passed to these commands
  (hence the above works)

- this change organises doctrees paths to reuse them between docs
  and pdf-docs (others only for completeness)

- this change turns on nitpicky mode to catch reference issues
  early

Overally, this makes it possible to quickly edit and observe doc
changes in the proper environment.

Change-Id: I8ae8a1ca5f6f77ea498573e343889611559b5c97
'}, {'created': '2020-10-23 08:15:18.000000000', 'message': '[tox] Optimise docs actions

Streamline all actions to behave the same (start with clean
env).

Additionally:

- doc envs do not require k-a to be (re)installed (skip_install)

  early

Change-Id: I8ae8a1ca5f6f77ea498573e343889611559b5c97

commit_message:
[tox] Optimise docs actions

Streamline all actions to behave the same (start with clean
env).

Additionally:

- doc envs do not require k-a to be (re)installed (skip_install)

- this change turns on nitpicky mode to catch reference issues
  early

Change-Id: I8ae8a1ca5f6f77ea498573e343889611559b5c97

[{'created': '2021-09-15 14:52:43.000000000', 'message': 'Change pki_create_ca condition

We have defaulted openstack_pki_authorities so condition if it is defined
will always be true.
The only way to override that behaviour by deployer is to define empty

commit_message:
Change pki_create_ca condition

We have defaulted openstack_pki_authorities so condition if it is defined
will always be true.
The only way to override that behaviour by deployer is to define empty
list of authorities (if none needs to be generated)

Change-Id: Ic9cb5dd397724525c0a826dbad690052ec59ecc7

Debian: apt-transport-https is transitional package

We do not need anymore as APT already knows how to do HTTPS.

commit_message:
[www] Add Xena index pages

This change prepares the Xena release by adding the index pages. It
still keeps Wallaby as the current release. We also add the files needed
for the next release, Yoga. These are not published since we aren't
adding the corresponding index page yet.

A future change will transition Xena to maintained.

Change-Id: Ied5cb4a103569fa7159d8556c6baadac0c0b5a09
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

subject: Check for passwords at old path during tripleo deploy
messages: [{'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-05 17:02:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-10-05 20:50:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-10-06 08:54:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-05 17:02:17.000000000', 'message': 'Check for passwords at old path during tripleo deploy

Commit ecafbae4ee7c403a3ef62e362c261585aabbec5c updated tripleo deploy
to use a different working directory. That broke upgrades because the
passwords file was still at the old path, and the passwords can not
change during a tripleo deploy upgrade. This patch checks the old
location for a passwords file, and if present, migrates it to the new
location.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I547ba1a7409290f4888e53dd45a883c263f0670f
(cherry picked from commit 3d28153ea148e6047083c2418b8905cbbd7b6c68)
'}]
commit_message:
Check for passwords at old path during tripleo deploy

Commit ecafbae4ee7c403a3ef62e362c261585aabbec5c updated tripleo deploy
to use a different working directory. That broke upgrades because the
passwords file was still at the old path, and the passwords can not
change during a tripleo deploy upgrade. This patch checks the old
location for a passwords file, and if present, migrates it to the new
location.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I547ba1a7409290f4888e53dd45a883c263f0670f
(cherry picked from commit 3d28153ea148e6047083c2418b8905cbbd7b6c68)

commit_message:
Add SendQueueLimit to collectd-amqp1

to limit the queue length and to ignore data added
earlier to the queue, when there is no remote to
connect to. This will limit the memory usage of
this plugin. By default, the memory may grow until
it runs out of memory.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/756365
Change-Id: Ie2db4b7487f9a8eaa7152b1b7984c52016219ed5
(cherry picked from commit 91cc43e01fb700bdadeac5e6e19d613f58c97eaa)

commit_message:
Fix PKI regen behaviour

We have introduced variables to control CA/certificates regeneration
however never used them anywhere.
This patch fixes that, so that haproxy_pki_regen_cert and
haproxy_pki_regen_ca are respected now.

Change-Id: Id6d5395d5976ec9393a55be7fe9a946cf9ce745e

messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-09-17 14:24:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-09-20 09:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-09-21 11:14:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2021-10-05 17:41:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-10-06 09:13:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-17 14:24:42.000000000', 'message': "Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I7042118a17d533c472f09bb2098bbc3c01195477
"}, {'created': '2021-09-21 11:14:02.000000000', 'message': "Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I7042118a17d533c472f09bb2098bbc3c01195477
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I7042118a17d533c472f09bb2098bbc3c01195477

commit_message:
Run TripleO jobs on CentOS8 instead of CentOS7

As we are cleaning up the c7 jobs and obselete featuresets [1].
This change replaces usage of CentOS7 in TripleO jobs by CentOS8.

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%22cleanup_featuresets%22+(status:open%20OR%20status:merged)

Change-Id: Id5bc15a22921a34399e926736d0a9a478598aff7

Add kuryr-k8s-sanity command

It would be beneficial for the project to have it's own sanity check
command. Where we can verify the configuration used for kuryr is
supported.

commit_message:
Disable Flask logs of metrics calls

We don't need to log every successful /metrics call on INFO level. This
commit switches the log level there to WARNING.

Change-Id: I3bc0e1c9e312381715f60a00ad8f52dbd601bb2f

ones.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-04-21 11:20:58.000000000', 'message': 'validation_json default os.environ PWD to HOME

In sudo case, os.environ does not have PWD key but HOME.
In that case, fallback on HOME instead of PWD will avoid the
None default value.

Change-Id: I1ac723b196cf65d6bce26f1661954bf7feca7caa
'}]
commit_message:
validation_json default os.environ PWD to HOME

In sudo case, os.environ does not have PWD key but HOME.
In that case, fallback on HOME instead of PWD will avoid the
None default value.

Change-Id: I1ac723b196cf65d6bce26f1661954bf7feca7caa

commit_message:
Decrease CPU usage of Prometheus exporter

Seems like a thread moving the metrics data into the service exposing
them in the Prometheus format was not constrained with any sleep. This
was causing increased CPU usage of kuryr-cni pods without a  real
reason to do it.

This commit solves that by rewriting the thread to use the common
multiprocessing queue pattern.

Change-Id: I0eacc37022fbf214c361dbc52b42281ffa5301fd

commit_message:
Add validation cli script

In order to be able to run validation without any
TripleO package installed and as a first step before
an Undercloud deployment, this review add a simple
CLI implementation which expose basic commands in order
to run, list and show validation on a system.

The user will only have to install either:
tripleo-validations rpm package or
pip install validations-common and validations-libs.

Change-Id: I7131ba18b625da282a529473cd804dbdae5a424e
(cherry picked from commit f70ad1a4281ec456aad3bedad47b6a2ed57be54d)

commit_message:
Make Galera desync operation more resilient

Sometimes, after a hard reboot of a controller node the Galera database
is up&running but not yet able to receive requests via the mysql.sock
socket, even if it is already opened. It takes few seconds to get it
working, but during that time, we should keep retrying the desync
operation until it connects to the database.

Closes-Bug: #1945639

Change-Id: I71fe4c14195ebcf11912753425ea15bc679b14f9

subject: Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour
messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-09-17 14:00:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-10-06 09:19:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-10-06 11:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-17 14:00:49.000000000', 'message': "Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: Ia55488a9fcc6b2824276bf824197ae8ea7af0177
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: Ia55488a9fcc6b2824276bf824197ae8ea7af0177

This was causing the nova-event-callback validation

commit_message:
Fix iDRAC import configuration job with errors

In iDRAC import configuration task can be completed with OK health
but having some errors, for example, when one disk failed to be
created and another succeeded.
Also changed to exclude informational messages for error reporting.

Story: 2009198
Task: 43253

Change-Id: I02b63547566c94ffa1a5d0e84bd1b1f10d28bfc3
(cherry picked from commit 391543946b6c3cb21ae1c08a21b6f730926c9b9d)

[{'created': '2021-05-05 07:14:10.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ibbb59bdd6b7ae0794ebe0f5c351e542e2affcf40
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ibbb59bdd6b7ae0794ebe0f5c351e542e2affcf40

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-20 14:57:31.000000000', 'message': "Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I1d9e22487272b1e1f0ce5f66045bc53d7c031d67
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I1d9e22487272b1e1f0ce5f66045bc53d7c031d67

commit_message:
Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

commit_message:
Fix that the path of functional test

before change:
$ tox -e functional -- --regex functional.tests.compute.v2.test_server
after change:
$ tox -e functional -- --regex tests.functional.compute.v2.test_server

the test unit path document should be change the above line.

(fixed wrong letter)

Change-Id: I49674fb0d56ee65c1f6328b9d960b16876173e2d

commit_message:
Replace assertItemsEqual with assertCountEqual

Follow-up of [1]. After this patch was sent, two more assertItemsEqual
were added in [2]. This patch is fixing it.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-openstackclient/+/789410

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 08:56:21.000000000', 'message': "Fix iDRAC import configuration missing task handling

Older iDRACs delete the task after 1 minute, since 5.00.00.00
the task is being kept for 10 minutes.
However, if encountering the issue, handle it and advise
user to either upgrade iDRAC if not already or decrease
checking interval.
Prior this node got stuck in wait mode forever if task was
deleted as raised exception by periodic didn't make the step
fail.

Change-Id: I5d500b7d53e9804aa3b54dc400d8621f40cd5d0c
(cherry picked from commit c174380db3eb409d8fd601b76e7027ea5c0f319c)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix iDRAC import configuration missing task handling

Older iDRACs delete the task after 1 minute, since 5.00.00.00
the task is being kept for 10 minutes.
However, if encountering the issue, handle it and advise
user to either upgrade iDRAC if not already or decrease
checking interval.
Prior this node got stuck in wait mode forever if task was
deleted as raised exception by periodic didn't make the step
fail.

Change-Id: I5d500b7d53e9804aa3b54dc400d8621f40cd5d0c
(cherry picked from commit c174380db3eb409d8fd601b76e7027ea5c0f319c)

subject: Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour
messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-09-21 14:08:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-09-22 11:36:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2021-10-05 17:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-10-06 09:17:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-21 14:08:18.000000000', 'message': "Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I1a45575423b0c7664f9f6586028c6c2b50a2ada1
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I1a45575423b0c7664f9f6586028c6c2b50a2ada1

commit_message:
Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I25b6e2afcf67f34d9b612adca6c0c6968b6308ce

commit_message:
haproxy: Add missing default_backend option

This change ensures the default_backend option is included in all
frontends, to solve the issue caused by unavailable backend service.

Closes-Bug: #1946045
Change-Id: I4856d33e6eaf5ca0fbfd9c4f33bd0d9433d107fa

commit_message:
[iRMC] Set polling after RAID is built

Avoid resume clean before raid is actually configured.
After creating the RAID, set up polling will notify ironic to wait for the
RAID configuration to complete before proceeding to the next step instead of check IPA.

Story: #2009231
Task: #43336

Signed-off-by: Zhou Hao <zhouhao@fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I7a551199224c24ca270b8b02d76b39386632c94f
(cherry picked from commit b617e43462ffff9a9220e89051455b7ae3b037ca)

commit_message:
Drop lower version requirement for networkx

With [1] to fix lower constraints job, networkx
requirement was bumped to 2.4.0, but since diskimage-builder
is branchless and to get it work with stable/train upper-constraints
for networkx i.e 2.3.0 can't bump to 2.4.0.
Also networkx-2.3.0 has dep on decorator>=4.3.0
so actual decorator issue with 3.4.0 shouldn't be there.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/diskimage-builder/+/811048
[2] https://github.com/networkx/networkx/blob/networkx-2.3/requirements/default.txt

Closes-Bug: #1945926
Change-Id: I93a2826019d9bb0d004f7daa661fdd1ca4269331

galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I04aebd5f24b21ebd664d54bdd6ba8e7331e06b41
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I04aebd5f24b21ebd664d54bdd6ba8e7331e06b41

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-05 06:57:16.000000000', 'message': "[iRMC] Avoid repeatedly resuming clean after creating raid configuration

Fixed the bug of repeated resume cleaning due to the value of `fgi_status` not being updated correctly when obtaining the
RAID configuration status of the node managed by the `irmc` hardware type.

```
Unexpected error when processing next clean step. TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
```

This `NoneType` error occurs because ironic resumes clean without waiting for IPA to get the clean steps, and then it tries to read the
clean steps which should be a list but actually is none.
During auto clean, resume clean should be triggered by IPA, but in this case, it is triggered by a iRMC periodic task which checks
the progress of running raid config.
This error does not occur every time, sometime raid can be configured, auto clean can complete without error and the node can be deployed successfully.

Story: #2009206
Task: #43265

Signed-off-by: Zhou Hao <zhouhao@fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I5a1c5708bdc1709e928f0faf7e18396e260dc551
(cherry picked from commit 8a5c672fa96521bd7d340c64b0c6ae2785643951)
"}]
commit_message:
[iRMC] Avoid repeatedly resuming clean after creating raid configuration

Fixed the bug of repeated resume cleaning due to the value of `fgi_status` not being updated correctly when obtaining the
RAID configuration status of the node managed by the `irmc` hardware type.

```
Unexpected error when processing next clean step. TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
```

This `NoneType` error occurs because ironic resumes clean without waiting for IPA to get the clean steps, and then it tries to read the
clean steps which should be a list but actually is none.
During auto clean, resume clean should be triggered by IPA, but in this case, it is triggered by a iRMC periodic task which checks
the progress of running raid config.
This error does not occur every time, sometime raid can be configured, auto clean can complete without error and the node can be deployed successfully.

Story: #2009206
Task: #43265

Signed-off-by: Zhou Hao <zhouhao@fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I5a1c5708bdc1709e928f0faf7e18396e260dc551
(cherry picked from commit 8a5c672fa96521bd7d340c64b0c6ae2785643951)

commit_message:
[iRMC] Set polling after RAID is built

Avoid resume clean before raid is actually configured.
After creating the RAID, set up polling will notify ironic to wait for the
RAID configuration to complete before proceeding to the next step instead of check IPA.

Story: #2009231
Task: #43336

Signed-off-by: Zhou Hao <zhouhao@fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I7a551199224c24ca270b8b02d76b39386632c94f
(cherry picked from commit b617e43462ffff9a9220e89051455b7ae3b037ca)

commit_message:
[iRMC] Avoid repeatedly resuming clean after creating raid configuration

Fixed the bug of repeated resume cleaning due to the value of `fgi_status` not being updated correctly when obtaining the
RAID configuration status of the node managed by the `irmc` hardware type.

```
Unexpected error when processing next clean step. TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not subscriptable
```

This `NoneType` error occurs because ironic resumes clean without waiting for IPA to get the clean steps, and then it tries to read the
clean steps which should be a list but actually is none.
During auto clean, resume clean should be triggered by IPA, but in this case, it is triggered by a iRMC periodic task which checks
the progress of running raid config.
This error does not occur every time, sometime raid can be configured, auto clean can complete without error and the node can be deployed successfully.

Story: #2009206
Task: #43265

Signed-off-by: Zhou Hao <zhouhao@fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I5a1c5708bdc1709e928f0faf7e18396e260dc551
(cherry picked from commit 8a5c672fa96521bd7d340c64b0c6ae2785643951)

commit_message:
removing "Nova failure" from no valid host was found description

because openstack-tox-molecule looks for a file called "no valid host was found" and not "Nova failure no valid host was found"

Change-Id: Ifade2b7e4d5ae88877c8e4e8c7bb616abdbb83cf

subject: Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour
messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-09-21 12:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2021-10-05 17:40:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-10-06 09:15:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-21 12:44:45.000000000', 'message': "Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I933e1edbd4260e2bd61bcceec3ddad8aea85353c
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I933e1edbd4260e2bd61bcceec3ddad8aea85353c

Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

commit_message:
Refactor galera_use_ssl behaviour

With PKI role in place in most cases you don't need to explicitly
provide path to the CA file because PKI role ensures that CA is trusted
by the system overall. In the meanwhile in PyMySQL [1] you must either
provide CA file or cert/key or enable verify.

Since current behaviour is to provide path to the custom CA we expect
certificate being trusted overall. Thus we enable cert verification when
galera_use_ssl is True.

[1] https://github.com/PyMySQL/PyMySQL/blob/78f0cf99e5d5351df0821442e4dc35c49a6390c6/pymysql/connections.py#L267

Change-Id: I99509b519c91d8fefc91745bb982866fe3fbc8e7

subject: Add support for CMR
messages: [{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2021-10-06 09:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12549, 'date': '2021-10-06 10:58:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThis brings the ops interface inline with the reactive one. Although I don't think this is the relation we should be using for ceph and cmr longer term."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-06 09:47:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for CMR

Although not a typical deployment scenario the ceph-mon charm will
support cross model relations.  To use this feature the local unit
name must be exposed on the relation so that the ceph-mon charm
can target broker responses back to individual units.

Juju obfuscates this to a remote-UUID label so the normal use
of the hookenv set remote unit does not work correctly.

Change-Id: I67142f782008f891f7dccba3a37e9616c3060af9
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for CMR

Although not a typical deployment scenario the ceph-mon charm will
support cross model relations.  To use this feature the local unit
name must be exposed on the relation so that the ceph-mon charm
can target broker responses back to individual units.

Juju obfuscates this to a remote-UUID label so the normal use
of the hookenv set remote unit does not work correctly.

Change-Id: I67142f782008f891f7dccba3a37e9616c3060af9

commit_message:
Fix unit tests

Charm helpers received some updates to support compression and rbd
mirroring options as part of pool creation requests.

Update relation test data to align with these changes.

Also drive-by add of py39 tox target.

Change-Id: Ia1c2b5d50df30156e5e56ce71eedb55c274385df

commit_message:
Xena final releases for cycle-with-rc projects

This tags the final release for all cycle-with-rc projects for Xena.
While not required, having PTLs ack this patch would be nice to include
that record in the merged metadata.

Release activity should now be frozen until this is processed on Oct 6.
Any bugfixes merged to stable/xena can be queued up and ready to go
as a follow on stable release after the coordinated release date.

There are different diff-start values for each project. This is used
when generating release notes to denote the point where the
stable/wallaby branch started to diverge from what is included on
stable/xena. For some, this will be the final Wallaby major version,
but if multiple RCs were done, this may show the initial RC1 release
version. This is normal.

This patch will be merged on Oct 6.

Change-Id: Ic315f2d0b9377975a9cf72fe284f71cb090ace5c

commit_message:
Update Quotas documentation

This patch updates the quotas documentation to include all of the available
quota management actions available in the Designate API. It also adds
OpenStack Client command examples for each action.

Change-Id: I5eec83e8c8afb356062bd8c883285645233dd6a3

commit_message:
Remove mistral

Mistral was deprecated in Wallaby and is no longer in use on the
undercloud and it hasn't been officially supported in the overcloud for
some time.

Related-Bug: #1945223
Change-Id: I6963453f53cb554ca8fdb58706f04838bbd11ba0
(cherry picked from commit cb630d03bed66b011ba57fcd61b7e8fb9532dd83)

commit_message:
Make Galera desync operation more resilient

Sometimes, after a hard reboot of a controller node the Galera database
is up&running but not yet able to receive requests via the mysql.sock
socket, even if it is already opened. It takes few seconds to get it
working, but during that time, we should keep retrying the desync
operation until it connects to the database.

Closes-Bug: #1945639

Change-Id: I71fe4c14195ebcf11912753425ea15bc679b14f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-23 22:07:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tripleo_nova_image_cache to not use md5 for validation

md5() calls will fail on a fips enabled system.  Glance, on the other hand,
has provided multiple hashing algorithms since Rocky, defaulting to sha512.
Use this value instead to check the checksum.

Change-Id: I9563526d72c1040eb94dc8c0c08e3bca70024f1f
'}, {'created': '2021-09-24 04:44:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tripleo_nova_image_cache to not use md5 for validation

md5() calls will fail on a fips enabled system.  Glance, on the other hand,
has provided multiple hashing algorithms since Rocky, defaulting to sha512.

commit_message:
Fix tripleo_nova_image_cache to not use md5 for validation

md5() calls will fail on a fips enabled system.  Glance, on the other hand,
has provided multiple hashing algorithms since Rocky, defaulting to sha512.
Use this value instead to check the checksum.

Change-Id: I9563526d72c1040eb94dc8c0c08e3bca70024f1f

commit_message:
Fix octavia deployment tasks for FIPS environment

Under FIPS, creating an md5 hash using ssh-keygen will fail.
As nova does not yet provide fingerprints other than md5, download
and compute the fingerprint locally insted.

Also fix genrsa, which is deprecated, and will also fail under FIPS

Signed-off-by: Jiri Podivin <jpodivin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ida652c946f8414b2f6ad35baf6e26d0e068da991

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5756, 'name': 'Terry Wilson', 'email': 'twilson@redhat.com', 'username': 'otherwiseguy'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 8655, 'name': 'Jakub Libosvar', 'email': 'libosvar@redhat.com', 'username': 'jlibosva'}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 32586, 'name': 'Elvira García Ruiz', 'display_name': 'Elvira', 'email': 'egarciar@redhat.com', 'username': 'elvira'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2021-10-05 11:12:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2021-10-05 12:19:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 32586, 'date': '2021-10-05 12:36:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nLGTM! Just out of curiosity: Was there any reason why the port binding update was out of the transaction context before?'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-10-06 07:32:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-05 11:12:49.000000000', 'message': 'Execute "migrate_neutron_database_to_ovn" inside the same DB ctx

All DB commands executed in "migrate_neutron_database_to_ovn"
should be executed inside the same write context. That will prevent
the DB transaction errors reported in the BZ. When a OVO object is
retrieved and updated, both DB commands should be executed in the
same DB transaction to ensure the DB object stored in the OVO
(that is a stateful representation of the requested columns) is
fresh and not modified by other transaction.

Related-Bug: #1939704
Change-Id: I754e2f9ad5b896fcc14ff30bd2901ccec2471907
'}]
commit_message:
Execute "migrate_neutron_database_to_ovn" inside the same DB ctx

All DB commands executed in "migrate_neutron_database_to_ovn"
should be executed inside the same write context. That will prevent
the DB transaction errors reported in the BZ. When a OVO object is
retrieved and updated, both DB commands should be executed in the
same DB transaction to ensure the DB object stored in the OVO
(that is a stateful representation of the requested columns) is
fresh and not modified by other transaction.

Related-Bug: #1939704
Change-Id: I754e2f9ad5b896fcc14ff30bd2901ccec2471907

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 08:42:40.000000000', 'message': '[OVN] Set NB/SB "connection" inactivity probe

For each NB/SB databases, set the inactivity probe timeout value on
the Neutron configured connection register.

Neutron connects to the NB/SB databases with the value defined in
"ovn_nb_connection"/"ovn_sb_connection" config parameters, with the
format:
- tcp:IP:PORT
- ssl:IP:PORT
- unix:socket_file

The connection register "target" column has the following format:
- ptcp:PORT:IP
- pssl:PORT:IP
- punix:socket_file

Closes-Bug: #1935842
Change-Id: If82ff2c92b8bec18ae3e895ce19a65cfeed9c90d
(cherry picked from commit 28f3017a90ecec6208aef9696cd7947972ec17d8)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Set NB/SB "connection" inactivity probe

For each NB/SB databases, set the inactivity probe timeout value on
the Neutron configured connection register.

Neutron connects to the NB/SB databases with the value defined in
"ovn_nb_connection"/"ovn_sb_connection" config parameters, with the
format:
- tcp:IP:PORT
- ssl:IP:PORT
- unix:socket_file

The connection register "target" column has the following format:
- ptcp:PORT:IP
- pssl:PORT:IP
- punix:socket_file

Closes-Bug: #1935842
Change-Id: If82ff2c92b8bec18ae3e895ce19a65cfeed9c90d
(cherry picked from commit 28f3017a90ecec6208aef9696cd7947972ec17d8)

commit_message:
Align tasks between config-download playbooks

cli-config-download.yaml and cli-config-download-export.yaml both
download the config from the stack. This commit aligns the tasks between
the 2 so that they both setup and download the config in the same way.

This allows a single playbook to be used by tripleoclient
(cli-config-download.yaml) as done in
Ia765c2c2ea548a1dcd20f592eda8741f40a1cf16

cli-config-download-export.yaml will be removed in a subsequent patch as
it will no longer be used by tripleoclient.

Change-Id: Ie47abe2d7c5d7891aceb88d9008d45d7922dea15
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
krb-service-principals support service_net_map_replace

Handle service_net_map_replace in the jinja2 logic so that
service_net_map_replace works for both default networks and
custom networks.

Enables a user either to change 'name_lower' of a network
and overriding the ServiceNetMap accordingly, as well as
user changeing 'name_lower' and use 'service_net_map_replace'
so that the default ServiceNetMap can be used.

Related-Bug: #1830852
Change-Id: Iae4341e9e7c888da4dd8d0dedd5ad28b7e0e6c40

subject: Fix awk expression
messages: [{'account_id': 14250, 'date': '2021-10-04 15:39:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-05 20:07:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-04 15:39:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix awk expression

The original awk '/WSGIScriptAlias/ {print $2}' could match
multiple lines as well as other configuration values, like
WSGIScriptAliasMatch. This fixes the matched string to
include a space as well as to exit after the first match.

Closes-Bug: #1942057
Resolves: rhbz#1954374
Change-Id: Ie8769230d6181b1b9fca4e60678ae9575c151c9f
(cherry picked from commit 64cf73a3c937877d9d525fb694e7ce86cc229f63)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix awk expression

The original awk '/WSGIScriptAlias/ {print $2}' could match
multiple lines as well as other configuration values, like
WSGIScriptAliasMatch. This fixes the matched string to
include a space as well as to exit after the first match.

Closes-Bug: #1942057
Resolves: rhbz#1954374
Change-Id: Ie8769230d6181b1b9fca4e60678ae9575c151c9f
(cherry picked from commit 64cf73a3c937877d9d525fb694e7ce86cc229f63)

commit_message:
Fix awk expression

The original awk '/WSGIScriptAlias/ {print $2}' could match
multiple lines as well as other configuration values, like
WSGIScriptAliasMatch. This fixes the matched string to
include a space as well as to exit after the first match.

Closes-Bug: #1942057
Resolves: rhbz#1954374
Change-Id: Ie8769230d6181b1b9fca4e60678ae9575c151c9f
(cherry picked from commit 64cf73a3c937877d9d525fb694e7ce86cc229f63)

[{'created': '2021-10-04 15:39:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix awk expression

The original awk '/WSGIScriptAlias/ {print $2}' could match
multiple lines as well as other configuration values, like
WSGIScriptAliasMatch. This fixes the matched string to
include a space as well as to exit after the first match.

Closes-Bug: #1942057
Resolves: rhbz#1954374
Change-Id: Ie8769230d6181b1b9fca4e60678ae9575c151c9f
(cherry picked from commit 64cf73a3c937877d9d525fb694e7ce86cc229f63)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix awk expression

The original awk '/WSGIScriptAlias/ {print $2}' could match
multiple lines as well as other configuration values, like
WSGIScriptAliasMatch. This fixes the matched string to
include a space as well as to exit after the first match.

Closes-Bug: #1942057
Resolves: rhbz#1954374
Change-Id: Ie8769230d6181b1b9fca4e60678ae9575c151c9f
(cherry picked from commit 64cf73a3c937877d9d525fb694e7ce86cc229f63)

[{'created': '2021-09-27 19:37:21.000000000', 'message': "Changing default tuned profile for ComputeVdpa

It's not necessary to have cpu-partitionning for vDPA hosts. While most
operators will probably use this, this causes a failure with tuned to
those that are not using it because isol cpu isn't configured.

Change-Id: I58b27e47b5aa6dee59cbfcd818ec72465f800cf8
(cherry picked from commit 33c1d9d34a276e2585a924faaea6fd6bf45bc817)

commit_message:
Changing default tuned profile for ComputeVdpa

It's not necessary to have cpu-partitionning for vDPA hosts. While most
operators will probably use this, this causes a failure with tuned to
those that are not using it because isol cpu isn't configured.

Change-Id: I58b27e47b5aa6dee59cbfcd818ec72465f800cf8
(cherry picked from commit 33c1d9d34a276e2585a924faaea6fd6bf45bc817)

(3 comments)

I guess I have concerns since this configuration, AIUI, essentially opens access to ironic's api surface based on roles, but doesn't specify project constraints like baremetal_admin did, and the only way this is opened in the newer model is with system scope usage. If we're overriding it with what are effectively the new system scoped roles, but setting that for all interaction then we're effectively opening the API access up completely which seems like a bad idea."}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2021-09-14 00:06:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

I reviewed the rules for both Designate and Octavia.
I didn't find any issues with the Octavia rules, but there are a number of corrections in the Designate rules I included in the comments."}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-09-14 13:26:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22:

(3 comments)

Thanks for the reviews, folks. I'll respin this shortly after some more initial feedback."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2021-09-15 12:23:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1

i dont think we shoudl proceed with this design.
with a downstream hat on this will be quite hard to support.
with an upstream hat on ooo should not be overriding the default policeis ship by the service projects.


i will try and review this again more fully but in general i think this is very problematic'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2021-09-15 20:20:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

(25 comments)

I highlighted compute policies that can be removed since they are redundant with the defaults in service.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2021-09-16 21:35:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1

(31 comments)

I didn't do *every* role:admin, but I think the idea/pattern gets across."}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-09-17 12:59:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1

(7 comments)

> with a downstream hat on this will be quite hard to support.

I fully agree with You on it. Maintaining that list in TripleO will be hard IMO

> 
>

I tend to agree with Kevin at this point.
Thanks Lance for the extended explanations in comments! I'll let others (i.e. Kevin) decide if we merge it for real or not. I'm not against it, especially since there's a clear path toward a better situation.
Just... well. "temporary things" are usually sticking around for longer than expected, within TripleO :).'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-10-05 19:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-18 21:41:23.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Provide a template to enable secure RBAC

This template attempts to build on all the work done through Wallaby to
use a common set of roles and scopes across OpenStack.

As services adopt more personas through default policy changes in their
codebase, we can remove more and more of this template. Ultimately, we
should just be left with oslo.policy configuration overrides to turn
this thing on across all services.

Eventually, when oslo.policy defaults to the new world of persona
enforcement, we can remove this entire file. That might be a long way
off, but we can get started by encapsulating all the complexity into a
single template for now.

Change-Id: I9957243d307758f56b84cde3a408006d8161fa41

'}, {'created': '2021-08-11 15:35:49.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Provide a template to enable secure RBAC

This template attempts to build on all the work done through Wallaby to
use a common set of roles and scopes across OpenStack.

As services adopt more personas through default policy changes in their
codebase, we can remove more and more of this template. Ultimately, we
should just be left with oslo.policy configuration overrides to turn
this thing on across all services.

Eventually, when oslo.policy defaults to the new world of persona
enforcement, we can remove this entire file. That might be a long way
off, but we can get started by encapsulating all the complexity into a
single template for now.

Change-Id: I9957243d307758f56b84cde3a408006d8161fa41
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

'}, {'created': '2021-09-28 13:39:37.000000000', 'message': 'Implement a tool for converting policy.yaml files to heat templates

This commit adds a tool that parses a directory of service.yaml policy
files and then converts them to the appropriate THT structure, using the
necessary service variables and templating.

The enable-secure-rbac.yaml is simply the current defaults generated
from code. First, generate all the policy files for each OpenStack
service:

  $ oslopolicy-sample-generator --namespace $SERVICE --output-file $DEST/$SERVICE.yaml

Next, uncomment all the default policies as a starting point for making
policy changes:

  $ sed -i 's/^#"/"/g' $DEST/$SERVICE.yaml

Next you can make changes to the policy files to reflect the changes you
want in your deployment.

Finally, you can generate the necessary heat template:

  $ ./convert_policy_yaml_to_heat_template.py -d $DEST

The tool outputs to stdout. It's up to the user to redirect to a file if
they wish to save results.

The enable-secure-rbac.yaml environment will be updated in subsequent
patches to implement project personas.

Change-Id: I9957243d307758f56b84cde3a408006d8161fa41
'}]
commit_message:
Implement a tool for converting policy.yaml files to heat templates

This commit adds a tool that parses a directory of service.yaml policy
files and then converts them to the appropriate THT structure, using the
necessary service variables and templating.

The enable-secure-rbac.yaml is simply the current defaults generated
from code. First, generate all the policy files for each OpenStack
service:

  $ oslopolicy-sample-generator --namespace $SERVICE --output-file $DEST/$SERVICE.yaml

Next, uncomment all the default policies as a starting point for making
policy changes:

  $ sed -i 's/^#"/"/g' $DEST/$SERVICE.yaml

Next you can make changes to the policy files to reflect the changes you
want in your deployment.

Finally, you can generate the necessary heat template:

  $ ./convert_policy_yaml_to_heat_template.py -d $DEST

The tool outputs to stdout. It's up to the user to redirect to a file if
they wish to save results.

The enable-secure-rbac.yaml environment will be updated in subsequent
patches to implement project personas.

Change-Id: I9957243d307758f56b84cde3a408006d8161fa41

When we set Debug: true, placement is the only service without
DEFAULT/debug set to true.

commit_message:
Define missing options for ssh connection wrapper

Since ansible-core we need to define all option defaults since they
will be passed to the original module we execute, otherwise connection
will fail with [1]

[1] https://paste.opendev.org/show/808609/

commit_message:
Remove ntp charm from non LTS releases

The ntp charm only supports LTS releases and cannot be deployed
to interim releases. This change removes the ntp charm from the
gate tests on non-LTS releases.

Additionally, this change removes the groovy tests are removed
from the gate since the groovy release is EOL.

Closes-Bug: #1946040
Change-Id: If64504baea7b1458dd244c765a04546513efb9a2

commit_message:
Remove ipxe_enabled ppc64le validation

This validation is no longer helpful, and it prevents deploying for
multi-architecture x86/ppc64le environments.

Change-Id: Ibb71e5dabaf09e45f0d2671aa0dfa60944728a2f
(cherry picked from commit f9e5d79f919bb67240cc689e54c66ef5d2008a57)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 8864, 'name': 'Artom Lifshitz', 'email': 'alifshit@redhat.com', 'username': 'artom'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27419, 'name': 'David Vallee Delisle', 'email': 'me@dvd.dev', 'username': 'dvd'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-05 06:06:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add a new bind-mount for vTPM logs

swtpm has its own log directory, and it's hardcoded in libvirt[1].
For the records, this location is currently set to:
/var/log/swtpm/libvirt/qemu

In order to keep some kind of consistency with the current log structure
in /var/log/containers/libvirt, we will keep the "qemu" subdirectory -
it already exists for other qemu-related services, therefore it makes
sense to keep that subdirectory.

This is possible since the swtpm log filename is composed of the
instance ID suffixed by "-swtpm.log", leading to a clear view.

[1] https://gitlab.com/libvirt/libvirt/-/commit/f9cd29a2e44d61da0fc94f245d27206ea66e1161

Related: rhbz#2007314
Related-Bug: #1902468
Change-Id: Ibc80621a622a4eb4ef31520439ded8a08ce50c96
(cherry picked from commit 98af2c581bce9228e2e35e29f2511dce9de34457)
'}]
commit_message:
Add a new bind-mount for vTPM logs

swtpm has its own log directory, and it's hardcoded in libvirt[1].
For the records, this location is currently set to:
/var/log/swtpm/libvirt/qemu

In order to keep some kind of consistency with the current log structure
in /var/log/containers/libvirt, we will keep the "qemu" subdirectory -
it already exists for other qemu-related services, therefore it makes
sense to keep that subdirectory.

This is possible since the swtpm log filename is composed of the
instance ID suffixed by "-swtpm.log", leading to a clear view.

[1] https://gitlab.com/libvirt/libvirt/-/commit/f9cd29a2e44d61da0fc94f245d27206ea66e1161

Related: rhbz#2007314
Related-Bug: #1902468

commit_message:
[WIP] Enable the ControllerRevision FT

This patch is enable the Functional Test for V1ControllerRevision.
The Functional Test for V1ControllerRevision was skipped because the Kubernetes Python Client v11.0.0 is only supported[1].
However, the V1ControllerRevision is supported the Kubernetes Python Client v12.0.0 and later by [2].
so the added skip decorator will be removed and the Functional Test for V1ControllerRevision will be enabled.

Related-Bug: #1910327

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/774215
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/791123

Change-Id: I7ceae3da279c8c8372f087b278a75791970c8568

messages: [{'account_id': 33688, 'date': '2021-10-05 13:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 33688, 'date': '2021-10-05 13:35:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 33688, 'date': '2021-10-06 07:33:48.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nRemoving Duplicate commit'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-05 13:33:20.000000000', 'message': 'Update sriov config service to handle nic partitioned PF

Create VFs using udev rules are required for attaching
and removing PF from a VM. On a reboot, when udev rules
trigger VF creation script and when a VF is attached to
vfio-pci driver, some of the VFs on that PF are not
initialized properly, resulting in VF not found issue.
Though it looks like driver issue, this patch avoids
this scenarios by removing the nic-paritioned VF from
the udev rule, as when one of the VF is attached to host,
the PF cannot be used by the VM.

Change-Id: Ic6738de42b9aa0346f48060c143c5f779b67867e
(cherry picked from commit fcf3d9cd126f30ecfe166aa5271a2f212a51a5a6)

The function setUp_pf_stubs() was added in the vdpa patch:
    https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/os-net-config/+/798926/
Since there is a dependency on this API for the tests of this patch,
it has been added here

Change-Id: I8d8b133631727b9fbd82c2e1d26307c7cdf60915
'}]
commit_message:
Update sriov config service to handle nic partitioned PF

Create VFs using udev rules are required for attaching
and removing PF from a VM. On a reboot, when udev rules
trigger VF creation script and when a VF is attached to
vfio-pci driver, some of the VFs on that PF are not
initialized properly, resulting in VF not found issue.
Though it looks like driver issue, this patch avoids
this scenarios by removing the nic-paritioned VF from
the udev rule, as when one of the VF is attached to host,
the PF cannot be used by the VM.

Change-Id: Ic6738de42b9aa0346f48060c143c5f779b67867e
(cherry picked from commit fcf3d9cd126f30ecfe166aa5271a2f212a51a5a6)

The function setUp_pf_stubs() was added in the vdpa patch:
    https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/os-net-config/+/798926/
Since there is a dependency on this API for the tests of this patch,
it has been added here

Change-Id: I8d8b133631727b9fbd82c2e1d26307c7cdf60915

commit_message:
Revert Horizon's Memecached config to use IP addresses

The library we currently use in Horizon for Memcached, python-memcached,
is unabled to resolve IPv6 domain names, but works fine with IPv6
addresses. Until we switch to a different library, we have to revert
https://github.com/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/49921d57f5753dffe032b9501d1101707ce8cc1e
and use IP addresses.

Change-Id: I1120c81ff3759b3bb344023728c1f695379fd365

commit_message:
Add free5GC VNF samples

As the current Tacker only provides a limited number of sample VNFs,
this patch adds free5GC VNF samples for the operation verification,
which corresponds to ETSI NFV Plugtests Conformance testing.

This patch includes the following VNF packages.

- VNF
  - VNF base
  - ChangeExtConn
  - Anti-Affinity
- CNF
- CNF on VM
  - CNF
  - VNF

Change-Id: I87f8dfc9d5d7f9f83e28016132b11470700bdb02
Implements: blueprint free5gc-vnf-samples

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-05 09:46:59.000000000', 'message': "Disable Neutron firewall

Neutron's firewall initialization with OVS seems
to be the source of our pain with ports not being found
by ironic jobs. This is because firewall startup errors
crashes out the agent with a RuntimeError while it is deep
in it's initial __init__ sequence.

This ultimately seems to be rooted with communication
with OVS itself, but perhaps the easiest solution is
to just disable the firewall....

Related: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1944201
Change-Id: I303989a825a7e35f1cb7b401134fd63553f6791c
(cherry picked from commit 8e173b88d138d0065e7f1bc668e3a0b65ce3be2e)
"}]
commit_message:
Disable Neutron firewall

Neutron's firewall initialization with OVS seems
to be the source of our pain with ports not being found
by ironic jobs. This is because firewall startup errors
crashes out the agent with a RuntimeError while it is deep
in it's initial __init__ sequence.

This ultimately seems to be rooted with communication
with OVS itself, but perhaps the easiest solution is
to just disable the firewall....

Related: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1944201
Change-Id: I303989a825a7e35f1cb7b401134fd63553f6791c
(cherry picked from commit 8e173b88d138d0065e7f1bc668e3a0b65ce3be2e)

commit_message:
Enable keystone_authtoken/memcach_use_advanced_pool for Sahara

Sahara was removed during Wallaby cycle and because of that it was not
updated when commit 09bcacd25a7217ce66eec10ccfda4847e6d3d87a was
backported from Wallaby to Victoria.
This change updates the Sahara templates to have consistent definition
with the other services.

Related-Bug: #1931047
Change-Id: Idb9a209b2651c1ff03c3ccaa14f4976a9f267e99
(cherry picked from commit 59599a86d7cd69240195f4455d8fe5e76c9ace51)

commit_message:
policy: correct domain_id match for admin_and_matching_domain_id

Ensure that the 'admin_and_matching_domain_id' rule correct
matches to the target.domain_id field, ensuring that domain
admins can actually query user and projects within a domain.

Change-Id: I4c000363dd7746f401613d99210e8ca12f34b010
Closes-Bug: 1830076

commit_message:
Add accepted formats on 'key' configuration

Add a bit more information on config.yaml about the type of keys
that can be passed as a parameter to the 'key' configuration.

Signed-off-by: David Negreira <david.negreira@canonical.com>
Change-Id: Ieeb0f598ca9a7188f81619c2b4fe88af14f260fd
Closes-Bug: #1942605

commit_message:
Disable expose_image_locations whenever S3 is enabled

This is a follow-up change on Id2e9d4351513341b5ee41fa8a8d677aca6580fca
Instead of relying users to set expose-image-locations=false which is
error prone, disable expose_image_locations from the charm side whenever
S3 backend is enabled not to expose credentials.

Closes-Bug: 1935743
Change-Id: Iac0f27418eec6c818df8cc3fa1c133db38d26069

[{'created': '2021-08-26 14:53:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix typo in ec2_create_credential policy

There was a trailing s in this policy and it caused the policy names to
mismatch, which causes confusion with the rendered policy files and
potentially causes uses with deprecation logic.

Based on the code, only ec2_create_credential is used, so this updates
the deprecated policy to be accurate with what's used in the code.

Change-Id: I54021986d17c57d7733d53caa4032c2767eaf25e

commit_message:
Fix typos in ec2 credential policies

There was a trailing s in two of these policies and it caused the policy
names to mismatch, which causes confusion with the rendered policy files
and potentially causes uses with deprecation logic.

Change-Id: I54021986d17c57d7733d53caa4032c2767eaf25e

commit_message:
Fix typos in application credential policies

We updated these policies when we introduces system scope and default
roles, but the policy names accidentally changed, which makes the policy
files render with an alias because oslo.policy thinks the names are
changing.

Change-Id: I1121f1abe769ee83ffc285103a95ee95540ce727

subject: Revert "Replace dstat with pcp-dstat"
messages:
[{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-09-08 19:21:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-09-09 07:19:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

dstat was dropped for a reason - it was buggy and had 0 support; on IRC I suggested we could create our own poor-man's solution as we don't need the whole pcp in CI just for the sake of seeing the progression of resource consumption"}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-09-09 16:26:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> dstat was dropped for a reason - it was buggy and had 0 support; on IRC I suggested we could create our own poor-man's solution as we don't need the whole pcp in CI just for the sake of seeing the progression of resource consumption

Yes, at one time SpamapS had taken over maintainership of dstat but I think the effort he was working on that needed a dstat like tool died several employers ago. I wouldn't mind using pcp if it installed reliably. But not being installable reliably due to overly complicated sets of systemd units that rely on each other indicate to me that this tool isn't quite what devstack wants either.

Digging around on the Internet Collectl looks interested and has some support for OpenStack clouds (which is what devstack is): http://collectl.sourceforge.net/OpenStack.html. It doesn't look like it has had recent releases either, but if it works maybe this is a good alternative?"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-09-12 18:12:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Let's move the discussion over to https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/808134"}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2021-09-14 14:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2021-10-05 23:09:00.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

There doesn't seem to be a desire to keep using the old dstat tool."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-09-08 19:21:14.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Replace dstat with pcp-dstat"

This reverts commit c19c1262c8b81f1cc543eafb9e5c3a34c4b632fe.

The pcp package fails to install on ubuntu fairly regularly due to a
timeout starting the pmlogger.service unit. It seems there have been
bugs for this in fedora [0] and while that bug notes a fix was
upstreamed that fix does not seem to be sufficient.

You can see the occurence of these failures by querying logstash for:

  message:"pmlogger.service failed because a timeout was exceeded." AND filename:"job-output.txt"

I'm pushing this change to start some conversation about the problem. If
we don't want to revert we should probably add a devstack bug for this
issue and an e-r entry to track it.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1721223

Change-Id: I657e802805db6835693e6b811799b189a71bec0d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Replace dstat with pcp-dstat"

This reverts commit c19c1262c8b81f1cc543eafb9e5c3a34c4b632fe.

The pcp package fails to install on ubuntu fairly regularly due to a
timeout starting the pmlogger.service unit. It seems there have been
bugs for this in fedora [0] and while that bug notes a fix was
upstreamed that fix does not seem to be sufficient.

You can see the occurence of these failures by querying logstash for:

  message:"pmlogger.service failed because a timeout was exceeded." AND filename:"job-output.txt"

I'm pushing this change to start some conversation about the problem. If
we don't want to revert we should probably add a devstack bug for this
issue and an e-r entry to track it.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1721223

Change-Id: I657e802805db6835693e6b811799b189a71bec0d

commit_message:
Add balancer module support for 'upmap'

This allows the user to change the configuration parameter
'balancer-mode' via Juju in order to set the balancer mode for Ceph.

Change-Id: I60dbd5f163e0c9d004275eff65db7ada41ad2660
Closes-Bug: #1888914

[{'created': '2016-02-11 14:47:46.000000000', 'message': "Documenting test_list_servers_by_admin when VMs already exists

When running Tempest tests test_list_servers_by_admin
and test_list_servers_by_admin_with_specified_tenant
with VMs already spawned by an user or Admin user,
tests will fail because tests try to compare the result
with an empty list.

But the error message is not distinct and understandable.
(Currently: 'MismatchError: !=:')

Proposal to add a human error message, to help user to understand
the reason of the failure.

Change-Id: Iad30328c8319a7ac9d370f127103f5198201f3ee
Closes-bug: 1542425
"}]
commit_message:
Documenting test_list_servers_by_admin when VMs already exists

When running Tempest tests test_list_servers_by_admin
and test_list_servers_by_admin_with_specified_tenant
with VMs already spawned by an user or Admin user,
tests will fail because tests try to compare the result
with an empty list.

But the error message is not distinct and understandable.
(Currently: 'MismatchError: !=:')

Proposal to add a human error message, to help user to understand
the reason of the failure.

Change-Id: Iad30328c8319a7ac9d370f127103f5198201f3ee
Closes-bug: 1542425

commit_message:
Add missing force delete backup tempest test

Tempest test for deleting a backup forcefully is missing.
Added os-force_delete in request body for forcefully deleting backup.

Change-Id: Ic64ed2b0a96c57f2fe06f6cec235732189244585
Closes-Bug:#1498430

commit_message:
Reseller-related test detects reseller support config

Only perform reseller-related setup (access ResellerAdmin role)
and run tests if reseller support is enabled in the config.

Closes-Bug: 1634233

Change-Id: I64ebc263a825f0006b241a07f3eee2a2cf912a6f

commit_message:
Immutable user source: test_credentials

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP
active directory implementation, tempest tests that create or
delete a user will fail. Instead of failing, we would like
them to skip. This change uses a class-level skip check
since each test in the class creates a user.
In [1], I introduced the config setting that allows
this to happen.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585536/

Change-Id: I7ac436b52f8d9d5a9871822e90efa60315c86c43
Partial-Bug: 1777047

commit_message:
Immutable user source: test_users_negative

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP
active directory implementation, tempest tests that try
to create or delete a user will fail. Instead of failing,
we would like them to skip. This change uses a testtools
decorator to avoid unnecessary modifications and allow those tests
to skip. In [1], I introduced the config setting that allows
this to happen.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585536/

Change-Id: I776653884355d058e145979445f9ef5739417667
Partial-Bug: 1777047

commit_message:
Immutable user source: test_list_users

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP
active directory implementation, tempest tests that try
to create or delete a user will fail. Instead of failing,
we would like them to skip. This change uses a class-level skip check
since each test in the class creates a user.
In [1], I introduced the config setting that allows
this to happen.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585536/

Change-Id: I5db46b59586760c4f8b9152588c312743f37ae0f
Partial-Bug: 1777047

commit_message:
Add NotAcceptable exception

This patch adds missed NotAcceptable exception and handle it
correctly by _error_checker() '

Change-Id: Ib9195ba86d7950f6a82812738b152b5c425fe170

subject: Added check for valid region variable
messages:
[{'account_id': 30424, 'date': '2019-07-01 14:33:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-07-01 14:33:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-07-02 02:14:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-07-02 05:42:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 30424, 'date': '2019-07-02 08:15:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

In our initial use case we only had one region so didn't think to specify it in the configuration. The tests still ran without complaint, however the first endpoint (sorted by ID) is always chosen. This causes issues if its the admin endpoint as for us it sits behind a firewall, and in the case of swift the full container/object url is not provided."}, {'account_id': 30424, 'date': '2019-07-02 08:18:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

Yes that is correct. If no valid region is matched then the previous value found from endpoint_type is used.

Currently filtered_catalog is overwritten with service_catalog which causes the next conditional to be false and results in the first endpoint found to be used.'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2019-07-02 08:49:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-10-05 21:56:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

No activities since long time, feel free to re-open it if still needed.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-10-05 21:59:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-01 14:33:38.000000000', 'message': 'Added check for valid region variable

Only update filtered_catalog if an endpoint with a matching region is found.
This stops the filtered_catalog variable being empty and overwritten
under the next conditional statement.

Change-Id: I63a9f054eeeadcba9a60b48252438f7240f73943
'}]
commit_message:
Added check for valid region variable

Only update filtered_catalog if an endpoint with a matching region is found.
This stops the filtered_catalog variable being empty and overwritten
under the next conditional statement.

Change-Id: I63a9f054eeeadcba9a60b48252438f7240f73943

commit_message:
Add scenario of bootable encrypted volume

This is to add test to create bootable encrypted volume,
attach it to an instance, and last detach it.

Depends-On: I1265cc2af2acb1d950c7a944e607a9707d2f69e6
Change-Id: Ia51fc89cc743121fbe686406eb3a1685518476bd

commit_message:
Update python version from 3.5 to 3.6 in setup.cfg

This updates the supported python version from 3.5 to
3.6 because OpenStack is moving toward 3.6 in general
so drop 3.5 in favor of 3.6.

Change-Id: I1ebcba8080430130bb3554c234a2f3fcf9be3870

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-06-21 10:04:49.000000000', 'message': "Add a test for detach/attach root volume

This adds a compute API test for testing the detach and attach of root
volume for instance in shelved_offloaded state.

The Nova change allows to detach the root volume from a shelved offloaded
instance, the tempest test is testing the following path:
- boot an instance from volume
- shelve the instance
- verify that the detach of the root volume works
- verify that the unshelve of the instance fails as the instance doesn't
- have a root volume
- attach the root volume
- verify that the unshelve of the instance works correctly.

Change-Id: Iab442d2f180b6bc6b584e9e5c6fb1433399343df
Depends-On: I08d2dc8685484a39b6c92fa2e65b82ab93a0a7f6

This adds a compute API test for testing the detach and attach of root
volume for instance in shelved_offloaded state.

The Nova change allows to detach the root volume from a shelved offloaded
instance, the tempest test is testing the following path:
- boot an instance from volume
- shelve the instance
- verify that the detach of the root volume works
- verify that the unshelve of the instance fails as the instance doesn't
- have a root volume
- attach the root volume
- verify that the unshelve of the instance works correctly.

Please note that this change also adds a schema change introduced in
nova with the 2.26 microversion. The schema change adds a new field
coming back for GET and LIST operations on nova servers.

Change-Id: Iab442d2f180b6bc6b584e9e5c6fb1433399343df

The Nova change allows to detach the root volume from a shelved offloaded

- attach the root volume
- verify that the unshelve of the instance works correctly.

Since the os-volume_attachments API response schema changed in 2.72 the
2.72 response schema changes are added:

- attach volume response includes boot_index
- show volume attachment response includes boot_index and volumeId
  can be null if the root volume is detached
- list volume attachments response includes boot_index and volumeId
  can be null if the root volume is detached

The 2.71 servers schema is also back-filled for the same related
volume attachment API schema changes to be used in 2.72.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/623981/

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

commit_message:
WIP: Add a test for detach/attach root volume

This adds a compute API test for testing the detach and attach of root
volume for instance in shelved_offloaded state.

The Nova change allows to detach the root volume from a shelved offloaded
instance, the tempest test is testing the following path:
- boot an instance from volume
- shelve the instance
- verify that the detach of the root volume works
- verify that the unshelve of the instance fails as the instance doesn't
  have a root volume
- attach the root volume
- verify that the unshelve of the instance works correctly.

Since the os-volume_attachments API response schema changed in 2.72 the
2.72 response schema changes are added:

- attach volume response includes boot_index
- show volume attachment response includes boot_index and volumeId
  can be null if the root volume is detached
- list volume attachments response includes boot_index and volumeId
  can be null if the root volume is detached

The 2.71 servers schema is also back-filled for the same related
volume attachment API schema changes to be used in 2.72.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/623981/

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Iab442d2f180b6bc6b584e9e5c6fb1433399343df

commit_message:
Allow password for tempest validation auth_method

This adds 'password' as a valid auth_method for tempest validation
auth_method. The code is already in place for ssh authentication via
password [1] but there was not a corresponding config option.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/2d6bcaa7/tempest/scenario/manager.py#L355-L366

Change-Id: I02cf519230e7ed10387f042903c5a39eb4ac7c97

commit_message:
Adding coverage of account-generator for tag and concurrency parameters

Adding test cases of tempest account-generator on basis of
tag and concurrency parameters used in command.
This patch will check when tag value used is blank
and high concurrency value to ensure the coverage of
tempest account generator.

Change-Id: I6ba477f38b9658f37cf3300955ce5d194fe1525f
Partially-Implements: blueprint tempest-cli-unit-test-coverage

commit_message:
Create resources configuration group

Create the group and move compute resource settings into it.

Partially implements blueprint tempest-resources

Change-Id: I89edd237ba581884d4cf13627dd771f8e4aff645
