(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2016-02-09 12:53:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

We seem to be building a bunch of volumes regression tests that are running pregate on every change (whether or not they are volumes related). This is just going to grow the test duration for unrelated patches a lot (volume tests are long).

I think we need a better model for regression tests that aren't run all the time before adding more like this."}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2016-02-09 15:16:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Sean, this test performs 2 checks (extend a volume that has a snapshot and actually check that volume is extended) that aren't tested anywhere in OpenStack. These are basic features that have to be covered by functional tests.

I work with Cinder every day and I am sure this would reveal bugs in 3rd party cinder drivers. (it has in GlusterFS).

I'll ask Cinder friends to look over this test, maybe they could weight in."}, {'account_id': 1207, 'date': '2016-02-10 14:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

@Sean Dague While I agree that these tests are long, they are also covering really useful test cases. It is fine starting a conversation about moving some of them around to reduce gate load or time, but gating the addition of new tests on the result of a discussion that is highly likely to take substantial amounts of time to reach an agreement on, and more time to implement, seems counter-productive.

If I start a mailing list discussion on the issue and start collecting opinions and options, can we maybe land this patch please?'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2016-02-10 15:58:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2016-02-10 16:25:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7350, 'date': '2016-03-10 14:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-03-10 16:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Verified+1

commit_message:
Add a volume extend scenario

It should be possible to extend a Cinder volume even if it has one
or several snapshots. There was once a regression here (see #1470558)

Also, perform additional verification through SSH because in the past
some Cinder drivers didn't do the expected thing. (see #1499452)

Change-Id: I99df7a20271f23e7899a0d0dd93bd995e41bbd0d

[{'account_id': 15755, 'date': '2018-10-12 11:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15755, 'date': '2018-10-12 13:16:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-10-12 14:39:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5490, 'date': '2018-10-12 16:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

nova availability-zone-list does a GET on os-availability-zone/details and falls back to the call without details only if it receives exceptions.Forbidden (aka 403). 403 is a valid choice, as the details are often only allowed for admin access.
So, clouds must either return valid data or 403 here to be discoverable with nova a-z-list.
This is planned to become an advisory test for InterOp, but first we need tempest to cover this.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-10-12 16:49:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> nova availability-zone-list does a GET on os-availability-zone/details
 > and falls back to the call without details only if it receives
 > exceptions.Forbidden (aka 403). 403 is a valid choice, as the
 > details are often only allowed for admin access.
 > So, clouds must either return valid data or 403 here to be
 > discoverable with nova a-z-list.
 > This is planned to become an advisory test for InterOp, but first
 > we need tempest to cover this.

@Kurt, implementation-wise, either the list availability zones endpoint raises a 403 Forbidden (hard authorization failure) or else returns an empty list (soft authorization failure). So I think the code needs refactoring. 

Looking at the code, it does indeed appear to raise a 403: https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20bc0136d0665bafdcd379f19389a0a5ea7bf310/nova/api/openstack/compute/availability_zone.py#L116

As context.can by default raises on failure (refer to `fatal`): https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20bc0136d0665bafdcd379f19389a0a5ea7bf310/nova/context.py#L237

So that means the catching of the 403 should be enough, no?'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-10-12 16:49:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > nova availability-zone-list does a GET on os-availability-zone/details
 > > and falls back to the call without details only if it receives
 > > exceptions.Forbidden (aka 403). 403 is a valid choice, as the
 > > details are often only allowed for admin access.
 > > So, clouds must either return valid data or 403 here to be
 > > discoverable with nova a-z-list.
 > > This is planned to become an advisory test for InterOp, but first
 > > we need tempest to cover this.
 > 
 > @Kurt, implementation-wise, either the list availability zones
 > endpoint raises a 403 Forbidden (hard authorization failure) or
 > else returns an empty list (soft authorization failure). So I think
 > the code needs refactoring.
 > 
 > Looking at the code, it does indeed appear to raise a 403:
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20bc0136d0665bafdcd379f19389a0a5ea7bf310/nova/api/openstack/compute/availability_zone.py#L116
 > 
 > As context.can by default raises on failure (refer to `fatal`):
 > https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/20bc0136d0665bafdcd379f19389a0a5ea7bf310/nova/context.py#L237
 > 
 > So that means the catching of the 403 should be enough, no?

For clarity, by "the code needs refactoring", I meant the Tempest test in question.'}, {'account_id': 15755, 'date': '2018-10-16 14:35:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15755, 'date': '2018-10-17 08:19:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 27078, 'date': '2018-10-17 09:00:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8871, 'date': '2018-10-17 10:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I noticed Zuul failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- neutron-grenade-multinode: unrecognized error
- tempest-full-rocky: unrecognized error
- tempest-multinode-full: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1763070

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2018-10-18 08:03:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add test az details returns 403

This test makes sure that a GET to compute /os-availability-zone/detail
returns 403 Status Code

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#get-detailed-availability-zone-information

Co-Authored-By: Kurt Garloff <kurt@garloff.de>

Change-Id: Ibe8b300a22e59f905fdd4bb87179651c7b22e76d

subject: Fix of verify_glance_api_versions

verify_glance_api_versions was used
image_v1.ImagesClient().get_versions() method which is work
incorrectly and always return dictionary without versions. As a result
verify_tempest_config disable all image version if could reach v1. Now
it's switched to _get_api_versions method. This should be enough by
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/versions/index.html#api-versions

Also remove meaningless test_verify_glance_version_no_version
verify_glance_api_versions colled only by verify_api_versions which
take services from endpoints list. So if image service present in
endpoints list but have no versions such configuration is broken and
we should not workaroud it by desabling service in config.

commit_message:
Fix of verify_glance_api_versions

verify_glance_api_versions was used
image_v1.ImagesClient().get_versions() method which is work
incorrectly and always return dictionary without versions. As a result
verify_tempest_config disable all image version if could reach v1. Now
it's switched to _get_api_versions method. This should be enough by
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/versions/index.html#api-versions

Also remove meaningless test_verify_glance_version_no_version
verify_glance_api_versions colled only by verify_api_versions which
take services from endpoints list. So if image service present in
endpoints list but have no versions such configuration is broken and
we should not workaroud it by desabling service in config.

Change-Id: I43e03a272d8c71671c2eaf78e621c03a2eec6866
Closes-Bug: 1611771

commit_message:
Fix the bug of test_list_images_filter_by_changes_since

After creating a new image, the image is not updated.
So it will return a empty sequence or collection.
At last,this issue will fail.

Change-Id: I967bac9cfdf3cc5b5753fa98d7ff113e5f9b4796

So, I think we don't need to replace six.iteritems(). Because, 

 1. There are 3107 six.itervalues() under openstack/ repos now. (I think it's too many.)
 2. The benefit is unclear.

If this has a significant improvement of the performance and/or making it more readable code, or something other benefits, let's merge. So, I'd like to know the benefit of this patch.

And I think the wiki[1] is just saying "we shouldn't replace dict.iteritems() with six.iteritems() anymore.", but not saying "we should replace six.iteritems() with dict.items()."

What do you think?

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common_patterns'}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2017-10-25 16:58:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

agree with Masayuki's comment completely."}, {'account_id': 6167, 'date': '2019-09-10 17:49:48.000000000', 'content': "Removed Code-Review-1 by Ken'ichi Ohmichi <ken1ohmichi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I3922c9220c749e252ae0c563c7bc9bd12d5a349d

commit_message:
Remove deprecated aliases for client managers

The patch aims to remove deprecated aliases for client managers. The
depcreated aliases were used to adapt to different Tempest plugins, and
in Queens it's the time to remove these aliases.

Change-Id: I768dcca98c086c97e9cfd12ec62e6045539ab2a5

commit_message:
Replace six.itervalues with dict.values()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common_patterns

[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Co-authored-By: Dai Dang Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I6c210926a2d8d5d91c4428b72121cef1aaf4871f

commit_message:
Specify the user_id query parameter

We can revert the quotas to default values for a project or
a project and a user. This patch adds reverting quotas for a
project and a user, specify the user_id query parameter in
delete_quota_set.

And also, in order to avoid duplicated code, I combine update_
quotas testcase and delete_quotas testcase.

Change-Id: Ia6b73473d0804ccc84be3bcbb80f25b3bbd72d99

commit_message:
Add firewall policy client

Firewall policy client is necessary to test the firewall.
the following client methods are now available for Tempest:
* create_firewall_policy
* update_firewall_policy
* show_firewall_policy
* delete_firewall_policies
* list_firewall_policies

Change-Id: I9f018d504a6bdef797d308242cca047d999e98e5

oh, I am just curious about why IBM Storwize need group spec while other cinder backends needn't?"}, {'account_id': 18288, 'date': '2018-03-01 09:30:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > IBM Storwize will behave like this. And group spec is implemented
 > > by community, no default value is set by community
 > 
 > oh, I am just curious about why IBM Storwize need group spec while
 > other cinder backends needn't?

We are precise that we do not allow creating group with the group type has no group spec is set. I think it make sense, one group is created with some purpose. So its group type should set with related group spec."}, {'account_id': 11186, 'date': '2018-04-11 08:12:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2018-04-11 16:08:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-07-09 06:32:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I agree with zhufl that this is driver specific things not general. We should tests the general behavior which Cinder API tells not the different internal behavior driver/backend doing. 

Tempest will be testing more standard Functionality provided by Cinder which should not be driver dependent. As per Cinder API ref, group spec is optional param to create group API  - https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/#create-group-type

We had similar changes in past and discussed in ML list. You can find more details here - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-May/116172.html'}, {'account_id': 27329, 'date': '2019-07-19 14:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Federico Ressi with the following votes:

commit_message:
Add choice to set group spec for group tests

Group related test cases will fail if group spec is null and
there is group type specs checking during group creating in
storage driver. Add choice to allow vendor to set spec in
tempest.conf when runing tempest.

Change-Id: I786cdb1688ab5d63973b4626e871674b3981b8e2
Closes-bug:1745307

Add unit tests for tempest run for generic parameters

There were some test cases missing for tempest run for
parallel, serial and save-state parameter.
This Patch will add the tests for them.

commit_message:
Add concurrency based tests for tempest run

There were no test cases exist in tempest run for
it's concurrency parameter.
This Patch will add the tests from both positive and negative
perspective of tempest run for concurrency parameter.

Change-Id: I0067eb969cc35c5737e7ee09e743655029218f76
Partially-Implements: blueprint tempest-cli-unit-test-coverage

commit_message:
docs: Use sphinx-apidoc library for autodoc generation

This package is used for automatic generation of autodoc
documentation which offers the following advantages:

* the Tempest framework for all modules is always built
  and kept up to date
* it is isolated in its own page layout
* it can still be linked to by other documentation pages
  easily
* the Tempest classes or modules can be linked by other
  projects

build_redirect function makes it possible to generate html
files with a redirect in case of moving or deleting pages.

Change-Id: I9a843ea024e71fbb377de5aa57cedafdd456269d

[{'created': '2021-09-29 19:15:00.000000000', 'message': "[stable-only] Set lower-constraints job as non-voting

This patch sets the failing lower-constraints job to non-voting until
final fix arrives for the failure.

With the latest setuptools (bundled into python virtualenv) the lower
constraints job started to fail on ussuri when it tries to install old
version of 'decorator'. The error message is:

  error in decorator setup command: use_2to3 is invalid.

The needed minimal version of 'decorator' would be 4.0.0, but it is
only needed if the latest version of setuptools (virtualenv) is used.
On old branches it would be good to pin setuptools (virtualenv),
otherwise we can face similar issues. Until the final decision / fix,
let's just set the lower-constraints job non-voting to unblock the
gate.

Conflicts:
  .zuul.yaml

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are because of job template name
difference (openstack-python3-ussuri-jobs vs

  * I4b2d321b7243ec149e9445035d1feb7a425e9a4b (Skip to run all
    integration jobs for policy-only changes.)

Change-Id: I01700882ca63f26975d4ecfd7d0a90ea95fe6614

commit_message:
[stable-only] Set lower-constraints job as non-voting

This patch sets the failing lower-constraints job to non-voting until
final fix arrives for the failure.

With the latest setuptools (bundled into python virtualenv) the lower
constraints job started to fail on ussuri when it tries to install old
version of 'decorator'. The error message is:

  error in decorator setup command: use_2to3 is invalid.

The needed minimal version of 'decorator' would be 4.0.0, but it is
only needed if the latest version of setuptools (virtualenv) is used.
On old branches it would be good to pin setuptools (virtualenv),
otherwise we can face similar issues. Until the final decision / fix,
let's just set the lower-constraints job non-voting to unblock the
gate.

Conflicts:
  .zuul.yaml

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are because of job template name
difference (openstack-python3-ussuri-jobs vs
openstack-python3-train-jobs) and because the following changes are
not in Train:

  * Ie1a0cbd82a617dbcc15729647218ac3e9cd0e5a9 (Stop testing Python 2)
  * I4b2d321b7243ec149e9445035d1feb7a425e9a4b (Skip to run all
    integration jobs for policy-only changes.)

Change-Id: I01700882ca63f26975d4ecfd7d0a90ea95fe6614
(cherry picked from commit 5ded5d8050c98f3e2ec61b340171d2a56735c2eb)

Setuptools 58.0 (bundled in virtualenv 20.8) breaks the installation of
decorator 3.4.0. So this patch pins virtualenv to avoid the break.

commit_message:
[stable-only] Pin virtualenv and setuptools

Setuptools 58.0 (bundled in virtualenv 20.8) breaks the installation of
decorator 3.4.0. So this patch pins virtualenv to avoid the break.

As the used 'require' feature was introduced in tox in version 3.2 [1],
the required minversion has to be bumped, too.

[1] https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-requires

Change-Id: I26b2a14e0b91c0ab77299c3e4fbed5f7916fe8cf

commit_message:
Add ability to noop a service

We want also be able to noop_resource('service'). In order to do that we
also add stubs for status, start and stop. Without this it fails with:
[root@controller-0 openstack-puppet]# NET_HOST=true DEBUG=True PROCESS_COUNT=1 CONFIG=/root/bandini.json python3 /var/lib/container-puppet/container-puppet.py 2>&1 | tee /tmp/puppet.log |grep Error:
<13>Oct  4 10:28:26 puppet-user: Error: /Service[rsyncd]: Could not evaluate: undefined method `status' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
<13>Oct  4 10:28:26 puppet-user: Error: /Service[rsyncd]: Failed to call refresh: undefined method `status' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
<13>Oct  4 10:28:26 puppet-user: Error: /Service[rsyncd]: undefined method `status' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
<13>Oct  4 10:28:26 puppet-user: Error: /Service[rsyncd]: Could not evaluate: undefined method `status' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
<13>Oct  4 10:28:26 puppet-user: Error: /Service[rsyncd]: Failed to call refresh: undefined method `status' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
<13>Oct  4 10:28:26 puppet-user: Error: /Service[rsyncd]: undefined method `status' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
[root@controller-0 openstack-puppet]# NET_HOST=true DEBUG=True PROCESS_COUNT=1 CONFIG=/root/bandini.json python3 /var/lib/container-puppet/container-puppet.py 2>&1 | tee /tmp/puppet.log |grep Error:
<13>Oct  4 10:29:03 puppet-user: Error: Could not set 'running' on ensure: undefined method `start' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
<13>Oct  4 10:29:03 puppet-user: Error: Could not set 'running' on ensure: undefined method `start' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop

Related-Bug: #1945962

Change-Id: I9ee8108fe749e787b82f8f4c226f44685ab21a99
(cherry picked from commit 8e6e49d28d4db79745371f737a16731f2faad00b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-10-05 14:39:32.000000000', 'message': 'Remove devstack bindep packages for building disk images

Disk image building has been moved to ironic-python-agent-builder,
and dependencies should no longer need to be managed inside the
ironic project.

Change-Id: I475361501cc5c3c9d03ce9dd21d2a3bf6e96de8a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove devstack bindep packages for building disk images

Disk image building has been moved to ironic-python-agent-builder,
and dependencies should no longer need to be managed inside the
ironic project.

Change-Id: I475361501cc5c3c9d03ce9dd21d2a3bf6e96de8a

Currently we assume that destination directory for certificates
isntallation would be created by the role which includes PKI
however it's not always the case.

Change-Id: Iec4ed507d1475f784d9c25d9b6153f8447f831ae

commit_message:
Ensure certificate installation path exists

Currently we assume that destination directory for certificates
isntallation would be created by the role which includes PKI
however it's not always the case.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server/+/807717
Change-Id: Iec4ed507d1475f784d9c25d9b6153f8447f831ae

commit_message:
[ceph-provisioner] Add support to connect to rook-ceph cluster

This is to add support for rook-ceph in provisioner chart so that
if any clients want to connect can  make use of it .

Change-Id: I26c28fac3fa0f5d0b0e71a288217b37a5ca8fb13

commit_message:
Refactor Charm Guide

Refactor the charm guide to have a Diataxis framework alignment. This
organizes the set of documentation into a variety of categories such as
getting started, how-tos, concepts, and reference material.

Change-Id: I7981ff6ac4b543020bfa78f352843370fcf09173

> Patch Set 9:

> I think Zaza's model readiness detection is broken since https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza/pull/451 landed

Unfortunately, zaza's readiness detection has improved and now (correctly) detects the neutron-api-plugin-ovn application as "not ready" as it has no units.  This can be resolved in the bundle by setting "num-expected-units: 0" for the application.  Unfortunately, this then breaks the tests as the tests assume that just adding the units will work and continue to use the same 'readiness' criteria from the bundle.  Thus:

1. The bundle needs to be updated with num-expected-units: 0 for the neutron-api-plugin-ovn application.
2. The tests in zaza-openstack-tests need to be updated to check for the right criteria when the topology is changed (neutron-api-plugin-ovn is related).

I'll do that as a separate set of changes.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-07-05 09:28:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-neutron-gateway/+/799443'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-07-06 08:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Test bundles for focal-wallaby and hirsute-wallaby

These are the test bundles (and any associated changes) for
focal-wallaby and hirsute-wallaby support.

Libraries sync.

hisute-wallaby test is disabled (moved to dev) due to [1] as bundle may
reference a reactive charm.

[1] https://github.com/juju-solutions/layer-basic/issues/194

Change-Id: I07a7c57f55822d3fa0e24133cf6e166d12945ebe
Co-authored-by: Aurelien Lourot <aurelien.lourot@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Manila: Hide password strings

This change ensures that parameters to define password strings are
properly hidden, because the credentials should be secret.

Change-Id: Ib07b204050a4a15266b7652ae5f284c56ecdad17
(cherry picked from commit 012121109eccab9155abd5567e5a1ebf3d70c208)

commit_message:
Update conditional to add tcib_extra params

In downstream, branch var is not sync with upstream release names.
Using release var instead.

Change-Id: Ief72a376786ee0e2f765c964ce2841b32c1ad422

~~~

We are already setting distro correctly in build-containers role.[2]

commit_message:
Pass distro to tripleo_container_image_build role

For downstream usecase, we need to properly set distro
flag in "openstack tripleo container image build" command.

By default, If we don't pass --distro flag centos is default[1]

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/src/branch/master/tripleoclient/v2/tripleo_container_image.py#L107

Closes-Bug: #1945163
Change-Id: I39fed3d952fe2dc1aaf530991c0c26237d043feb

commit_message:
Use kolla_internal_vip_address instead of aio_vip_address

The kolla_internal_vip_address variable was added in Wallaby, and the
vip_address attribute is now deprecated.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kayobe/+/805245

Change-Id: I747d9acc649f18206cbb23c0df6995bade335331

commit_message:
Support configuration of firewalld

Adds support for configuring firewalld for CentOS hosts managed by
Kayobe.

* create zones
* set default zone
* set zone for interfaces
* define rules

Change-Id: Id60e25e129e323f3c07e702bb81a11efc530fb3e
Story: 2008991
Task: 42644
